Reviews.Title: “Wonderous Rome and wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzie8
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a perfect location. Excellent rooms with all amenities - good towels, plenty of toiletries - and wonderful breakfast - sausages, scambled eggs and lovely crispy bacon along with fruit salad, cereals, cold meats and cheeses and a huge variety of breads and cakes. The staff were friendly and helpful and made dinner recommendations etc. There was tea/coffee and orange juice available each afternoon free of charge and many places to eat locally. The area felt very safe for two ladies travelling and everything was in walking distance. We took the metro from Termini to Cavour - one stop, one euro and the hotel it less than two minutes walk from the station. Also took the Alitalia bus from the airport to Termini which worked very well. One tip if visiting the Vatican book it online before you leave to save waiting for hours in the queues but only book the entrance fee not a guided tour. You will be better getting an audioguide when you get there so you can take your time going round, rather than the guided tour. We sped through all the museums we really wanted to look at with a guide speaking in broken english then spent an hour in the Raphael rooms before being chucked out into the sistine chapel. We had to go round again to see what we came for. All of Rome was wonderous and we can't wait to go back. Thank you Duca d'Alba for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a perfect location for all major attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Linda O
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay, 25th March to the 28th, at the Duca d'Alba for my family of 4 did not disappoint ! The rooms were ultra clean, fabulous showers, crisp bed linen changed daily , soft and plenty bath towels, double sets of windows that kept street noise out , good air con ......and a fab location where one is able to walk to all major attractions, even the Vatican. The most reasonable restaurants are within the hotel area and all offer good Italian food......just keep to the side streets of this area where real Italians live and work and you will not go wrong. Once on the main streets your final food bill can double!! The hotel location is good because there are independent shops and artisans right next door from chocolate producers to wrought iron welders.....there is a real buzz at night where families meet outside. We felt perfectly safe at all times. The hotel staff were helpful and well organized , from the front desk to the smiling breakfast staff. The breakfast was good with lovely creamy scrambled eggs & crispy streaky bacon, fresh fruit , croissants etc........my only problem was with the croissants which were glazed in sugar!!! A minor dislike. I took advantage of the discount offerred directly booking via the hotel website.....an invoice was given as cash was handed over on the day of arrival. I would certainly stay at the Duca d' Alba again and never hesitate to recommend it. If you want a VERY clean room and bathroom , then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ddddddCo_antrim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days, from the minute we entered the front door we were treated really special. When we checked in we were asked if we would like a drink(tea/coffee,wine etc) this was brought to a lounge area, while the porter took our cases to our room. Then the receptionist showed us to our room, nothing was too much bother for the staff as we were enquiring about restaurants etc, they were extremely helpfull. Breakfast was very adequate sausages/bacon/egg/ham/chesse/fruit/cereal etc, rooms were small but we have stayed in smaller in europe, could not fault this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it or staying in it again., It is very handy to Cavour station, but within walking distance from Termini

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the Forum”
Reviews.Author: Carla S
Reviews.Content: Guided by the reviews on tripadvisor we booked a three night stay at Duca d'Alba. We were not disappointed. The hotel is easy to reach from Termini station, on foot or one stop by subway. It lies in a small street, just behind the busy Via Cavour, very close to mayor sites like the colosseum and the Forum. We stayed in room 107, with a window facing the street. The room is small, but everything we needed was there, and it was decorated just like in the pictures on the hotel website. The windows were perfectly sound proof, necessary because of the pub on the other side of the street. I booked the room through their website, receiving a discount when paying in cash at arrival. I payed the day after we arrived and received a proper receipt. The price was very reasonable for a hotel in Rome and included a, especially for a southern european country, excellent breakfast. I would definitly recommend this hotel, especially for a first time stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Family Run Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bladesmum
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this hotel which we found by chance a few years ago and is the only place I would consider staying in Rome now. With hotels in Rome you so often do not get what you pay for and I have come away disappointed from stays in supposedly five star accommodation. This little hotel is only a couple of hundred yards from the Cavour metro and five minutes walk to the Colliseum. It is in an area where lots of Romans live and so has very well priced, excellent bars and restaurants around it where you won't be just surrounded by tourists and rip off prices. Try Il Covo just around the corner, Wanted or Osteria al 16 for starters and you won't go far wrong. The hotel is constantly updating the rooms and prides itself on friendly service. Our room this time was on the second floor and was somewhat larger than the room with balcony that we had on the 4th floor last visit. Bathrooms are very well done and bed linen crisp and clean. The rooms are reflected very well on the hotel website and are a true reflection of what you will get-very boutique in style. Breakfast is more than adequate and is included in the rate which is not the norm for hotels in Rome. There is no lunch or evening meals served but all the local bars and restaurants are open all hours and you can fall out the door and find somewhere to eat. Book direct with the hotel website being carefull not to be caught out by what looks like the official website from booking companies. I was almost caught until I noticed it did not say offical hotel website. You can get good deals if you book in advance and agree to pay cash on arrival. If you want a quiet room ask for one at the back of the hotel or in the annexe next door. Annexe rooms are very much cheaper although again I do not know why-they are much bigger than the main hotel rooms and have very large bathrooms and lovely decor too. The annexe is literally two steps from the front door and the entrance stair case is lovely. This is not an area for great views as the Via Leonina is tucked away behind the Via Cavour but this hotel is great in every other way-just walk 50 yards down to the corner where one of the best piazza places in Rome 'Wanted' is and look up and you will see the Colliseum. Best of all you are away from the more polluted main roads.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs- keep away”
Reviews.Author: tosaka
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. It had deteriorated. Rooms were dirty. On our second night, we discovered bedbugs in both our rooms, our adult daughters and ours. Run away from this hotel, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “The best things come in small packages ................”
Reviews.Author: sarah j
Reviews.Content: Ok well this Hotel is perfect for couples or small groups of people. At the moment they are renovating the loby/receiption but this does not take away from the excellent service provided by the staff. They are warm and very helpful....nothing too much trouble. The breakfast was great....although i did see a group of 6 try to sit together which was near impossible which is why i say that the hotel is perfect for couples or small groups. The room we were given 104 was very small no room to swing a cat) and no views at all. but again suitable for what we needed and very clean. I would stay here again - no question.

Reviews.Title: “If this is a 4 star hotel a non star hotel would be jail...”
Reviews.Author: m b
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in room 113 in the Annex tight now listening to my neighbours arab music. I wonder if the walls are made of paper in this hotel. Very friendly staff, clean rooms but the reason I live inte a hotel is that I need a place to sleep and that is imposible in this hotel. I come from Sweden and a non star hotel has a higher standard than this hotel. If the hotel will sound proof the rooms this is a good hotel, otherwise I have to warn you about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yezman
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 rented 2 rooms here at the suggestion of a friend. He said best location in Rome and he was right. Rooms very clean, great linens and updated decor. Small, but good size for Europe. Felt very safe. Price was very good for quality, not to mention it included an excellent included breakfast and free internet. Very close to numerous attractions, restaurants and the best part is that you feel like you are planted right in the middle of a Roman City....not in a tourist pit. Staff was very helpful and professional, not overly friendly, but very professional. I would definitely stay there again. My wife thought the mattress was a bit thin but the rest of us had no issues. The great gelato right next door made up for the mattress apparently....:)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but not a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: RuiAna_ptbr
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights on a business trip to Rome, with good luck to get very nice winter days. Regarding the hotel, there were some renovation works under way in the ground floor, which is not nice but I understand these have to be carried out in this kind of building and it makes sense to do that in the low season. It's definitely not a spacious hotel, with lots of mirrors to make it seem larger. Breakfast is quite average for a 4-star and I didn't get a view from my room so I kept the blinds always shut. The safe in the closet was too small for a laptop, even for an iPAD. However, the staff at reception were kind and attentive. Wi-Fi access is free of charge and works very well (quite fast actually), a plus for this hotel, which is near the Via Nazionale and has a metro station (Cavour) just a stone's throw away, even though there's a line of garbage bins on that direction... Several restaurants and gelaterias nearby also provide plenty of choice for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Kico_mei
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. The rooms are ok, but the bathroom was smelling cigar on the begging. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “MUST TRY”
Reviews.Author: Barry P
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Rome so the fact that it wasn't right near Spanish Steps and Trevi was actually preferred. It was in a nice little neighborhood very close to a train station. A small piazza right around the corner for a drink at night or espresso in the AM. The room was small but aren't they all in Rome or NYC for that matter? The place was a cool boutique hotel with great service. Price I think was reasonable, you pay for service, quality and decor so I don't feel it was too high. I also booked this hotel like 1 week before I travelled so I bet you can get better deals if you book ahead of time. This was great for my girlfriend and I but if it was business it would have been great as well. For a family probably a little too boutique for me. But then again what do I know I don't have a family! All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjay88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small by American standards but for a European city like Rome, it was perfect. It had a private bathroom (a huge novelty) and an elevator. The elevator was small but it certainly came in handy with my 50 pound suitcase. The hotel itself is very clean and fairly easy to locate. It's located right off the Metro, on the Cavour stop. This is quite handy for anyone coming into Rome from the Termini station, as Cavour is the first stop after Termini. The front desk staff were quite helpful in recommending restaurants and tourist places to visit. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Colliseum and 15 minutes to Trevi Fountain. You have to surrender your room key when leaving the hotel, so make sure your room has a safe where you can store your passport and any other valuables. I've heard not all rooms are fitted with a safe, so double-check before checking in. The room itself was quite small but since I was traveling alone, it was fine for me. It barely fit a bed and an armoir but at least the bed was a double. A continential breakfast was included and it was a typical European breakfast. The food was fresh and the assortment of juices was a nice addition. I had pre-paid for my room but this did not include a 3 Euro charge when checking out. Overal, I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. It was centrally located in the city and perfect for those that are looking to take the Metro everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Friendly in Old Rome”
Reviews.Author: JSJ18
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duc d'Alba is located very conveniently near the Cavour Metro station in the Monti neighborhood. We visit Rome every year and have never before stayed in this charming old section of Rome not far from the Forum. The neighborhood is home to many charming shops and small restaurants and a bit off of the beaten path even though it is in the center of Rome. Duc d'Alba offers very stylish, if compact accommodations at a fair price for the quality offered.. Our room on the third floor was very comfortable, clean and attractively decorated. It was also very quiet due to the double glazed windows that were able to completely screen out the very lively street sounds. Breakfast was more than adequate, served in the bright ground floor breakfast room. All the staff were genuinely friendly and helpful in a manner that shows the successful efforts of the management to create a superior hotel. We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “no errors”
Reviews.Author: PaulaRegina_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Hotel clean, clear, neat, quiet in the extreme. New beds, comfortable and soft. Sheets of high quality, as well as towels. Delightful reception with staff always cheerful, courteous and professional. Breakfast plentiful and delicious. And what about the porch? I am jealous of not being able to have an equal in Brazil :o) I have nothing to say to discredit the Hotel. Nothing! Absolutely the best. Returning to Rome, always, always Duca D'Alba.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small and area is a bit rough”
Reviews.Author: NaumT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last winter. The room was very small, hard to open the bathroom door. ALso you can hear everything the neighbors are doing.... Location is close to the Colesium, but aside from that you feel like a local because of the area. For the price and the city, its a fine combo, just would of course want a bit more. A true 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tammy R
Reviews.Content: So close to everything! Lots of boutique, quirky shops around every corner. Awesome cafe's and restaurants and set on a cobblestone street with loads of atmosphere! People in the Hotel were great. Very helpful and courteous! Breakfast was nice and is included in the room rate. It was the perfect end to our romantic holiday in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Sightseeing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TikiRoo
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome upon our check in, used lift to 3rd floor, opening window with shutters overlooking the street. Adequate room size with plasma tv on the wall. Bathroom clean and tidy, small compared to Australian style. The bed, two singles zipped together was firm, but after a days walking and sightseeing it was comfortable enough to crash out and have a good nights sleep. Breakfast was fresh and tasty ( pastry, fruits, yoghurt, breads, cheese and parma ham, etc, etc ) and the service was always prompt and friendly. The front office staff answered all our touristy questions with great detail, gave us a map and the central location of the Hotel made 3 days of sightseeing a breeze. Best of all, we could always get a cup of tea or coffee at 9 or 10pm in the kitchen / bar when we returned from our days adventure. For a clean and comfortable bed, hot shower and central location Hotel Duca d Alba is hard to bet.

Reviews.Title: “great location, a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: acarocid
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very clean, the staff very attentive and helpful... great location... great prima colazione ... you can have good wifi no cost in the lobby... but.. small rooms and the decoration could improve... that is what makes it overpriced... i think rome in terms of hotels is expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ScottJI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a trip to rome. We were to arrive on Sunday morning and stay at this hotel for several days. The night before we had to leave, my wife got ill and I had to take her to the hospital. She needed to have surgery in a few days. We of course had to cancel our trip. We contacted this hotel and their refund policy doesn't allow for refunds within 24 hours. I certainly understand this, as they cannot easily book the room so easily in that time frame. We were refunded for the remaining nights, but not for initial one. However, these were extenuating circumstances, and I also asked FOR A CREDIT, not just a refund. We are planning on going on this trip when my wife recovers, and would gladly have stayed at this hotel again due to its location. You would figure that if they gave us a credit to be used at the hotel, it would be in my best interest to re book the entire stay with them when we go again. I don't speak Italian, so I sent an email to their general manager thru the contact us link on their website. NO RESPONSE. I just can't understand this behavior in these times. Clearly I am choosing another hotel when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet near attractions, good service & clean”
Reviews.Author: CalvinOng1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days at the hotel. Location is good, near Colliseum and Cavour station, with some eateries around the hotel. Felt clean and safe. Hotel room was clean and staff were very helpful and polite. Had same breakfast for 6 days though. Towels were changed regularly and no issues with the hotel. Walking around the place was no problem, even to Termini, which must be around 20 minutes walk. Price seemed reasonable and hotel room had free wi-fi, which is rather important if you are travelling on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location very good service”
Reviews.Author: pecaMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. My first room was beautiful great bathroom. The A/C was not working. After 3 attempts the manager offer to change us to another room. The room was smaller bathroom. The shower was about the size you get in a ship. But it was clean and for a couple I think it was great. Our experience in Italy is that the A/C works when you put your key, it takes a little to cool the place. The breakfast was very good, it included eggs and the coffee was made to order. Would definitely consider the place again. Nice restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: evheg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our family for our wedding in Rome. The rooms are small but most hotel rooms in rome are. It's in a very handy location near the metro station and you can walk to the coliseum. the street it's on has little cafes and restaurants the breakfast was lovely would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Indi S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duca d'Alba .. fantastic loaction it is literally a couple minutes walk from the Coloseum. The staff were friendly, warm and helpful. The rooms are clean and have everything you need although a little small they are perfect. The hotel is set on cute little road surrounded by some fantatsic restaurants and boutiques. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dobena
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & great location, just a few minutes walk from the colosseum. Staff were very friendly & helpful - even upgraded my room to one with a balcony - so nice to sit out and enjoy the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place, nice staff, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Femully
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty good (basically across the street from St. Peter in Chains) and around the corner from the Collosseum. Lots of little restaurants nearby and an Irish pub across the cobblestone road. Room was small, bathroom tiny too, but it is what it is. Our room had a view of nothing, but other rooms may have had better views. Room was very clean. The wi-fi is a little bit of a pain, but still is free. Friendly and helpful staff. There is a subway station only a minute away, so it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, great staff, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: LEWISFAMILYY
Reviews.Content: We selected this boutique hotel for its proximity to the ruins of Rome since we were first time visitors to this city. Not only is the charming Duca D'Alba Hotel in a perfect location and we walked to all the major ruin sites, but it is in a great neighborhood with thriving shops and restaurants and a charming Piazza with an ancient fountain. The staff were so lovely and welcoming and treated us like honored guests, providing excellent restaurant and site-seeing advice. The hotel was beautiful and exceptionally clean and up to date with wonderful bathrooms and good sized rooms by Rome standards. The breakfast was wonderful too, and the staff so polite making sure to inform each guest before the breakfast buffet closed down. Because every hotel in Rome is potentially noisy since there are so many people walking in the evenings, this hotel despite being next to restaurants and bars, was silent in the rooms due to not just double windows, but two sets of double windows! The decor was very modern and lovely but with touches of marble and traditional furniture so beautiful that it makes one want to move to Rome! From Rome we went on to Madrid where our hotel was not nearly as special and we realized that the hotel and the wonderful staff was a big part of why we loved Rome so much!~

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly service in a nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie_399
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel from Trip Advisor for my last night in Rome. The location was good--next to the Coliseum. When I first got to Rome, I stayed at the Hotel Adriano, which I loved, but for a first trip to Rome, it was difficult to figure the surrounding neighborhood out. The Duca D'Alba would be a much simpler neighborhood for first-time visitors to Rome. The front desk staff at the Duca D'Alba was wonderful and very friendly and willing to help with anything. I stayed in a double room which was small, but adequate. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner, but was acceptable. The breakfast selection at the hotel was very good with lots of choices. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely consider it again upon returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Room upgrade was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: wetravel_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We took an overnight train from Munich to Rome and went straight to this hotel in the late morning. Unfortunately the room was not ready when we arrived but since we had waited, they were kind enough to give us an upgraded room that was very spacious and clean! One of the best hotel rooms we stayed in while in Europe. We were having trouble finding availability on a tour of Ancient Rome so we asked the front desk when we arrived. They happily provided us with a brochure for a tour company and even called the company to check availability and schedule the tour. The tour was a huge waste of money and is the reason for giving this hotel four stars instead of five. We were also unable to use wireless in our room but it worked in the lobby. Overall, we enjoyed our 2 nights at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, breakfast & location!”
Reviews.Author: Patagonia8
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal; practically next to Colloseum ; breakfast is lovely with cappucino, bacon, eggs, cereal and lots of fresh fruit; rooms are small but nicely done. Great gelato place right next door. Metro station right there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler60805
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel is even prettier in person than it is online! Spotlessly clean, close to all the major sights. The man who runs the front desk knows EVERYTHING!! He helped us with restaurants, trains, directions, you name it. Plus he has a wonderful sense of humor. The only negative is that the shower stall, like nearly all of europe, is very small. Definitley worth the price! Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Return One-Night Transit Was Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mpkukla
Reviews.Content: Flew into FCO on a Friday, to meet spouse at FCO on Sat and continue to Amalfi Coast. Duca d'Alba single-person room was tiny, but like a jewel-box. Finishes and details in room were outstanding. Located on a tiny street 60m from Metro stop, several excellent restaurants, and around a couple of corners to a wine & snack convenience store on a small square where locals gather on Friday nights - not to mention within sight/walking distance of Colliseum/Forum. Will ONLY ever stay here on my return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A quality place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CamWebb
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four. We had an unbelievable room on the top floor with a great balcony. The room was top quality, small but not unusual for Europe, breakfast was great and the location central to all of ancient Rome. The service was outstanding - English not a problem with numerous restaurants nearby. I would thoroughly recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOMS, NICE BREAKFAST, FRIENDLY STAFF,”
Reviews.Author: ELENAPAPATHENS
Reviews.Content: The room we booked (213) was not in the main building, but we knew it from the beginning. The room was not spacious (around 12 m2) , the windows were claustrophobic. The room was rather clean, so was the bathroom. The hotel was clean, the staff polite and the breakfast sufficient (croissants, toasts, breads, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, cheese, corn flakes, juices, cappuccino with no extra charge). No WI-FI on the side building (not on my i-phone at least). The bed was good, since the matress was not soft. In my opinion the price was high for what similar hotels in other cities/countries have to offer. The area was not dangerous (the hotel is in a small alley actually) and the Colosseum is around 10- 15 minutes by foot. I wouldn't stay there again, unless the price was half and the room was bigger, but many say that small room is the rule in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice spot, great location”
Reviews.Author: wenztravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, lots of restaurants nearby and just blocks from the Coliseum. The rooms are indeed small, but still quiet, clean and modern. The staff are friendly. The breakfast is lacking, but what you come to expect anywhere in Italy. The gym, is not a gym by any means so I wouldn't book based on that expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hestapea
Reviews.Content: Really nice room and great staff. The breakfast was also really good. We stayed for 6 nights without any problems. There is a gym, but its not very up to date and in the basement. There is a great gelato place around the corner and the metro (underground train) is a block away. Rome itself is an interesting place. The shopping was fantastic. We went to a leather place called Infinity and dealt with a guy named Eugenio Provaroni...the was so nice and gave us a great deal. The only negative about Rome is the smokers. They are everywhere and have no idea how smelly and disgusting smoking is. They throw their butts on the ground, so the streets are covered with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertEaston
Reviews.Content: Delightful place to stay. Staff very helpful and polite. Breakfast very good. Noisy if your room faces the street (despite two double glazed windows), but if you must have quiet, go stay in the country. Metro very close. Colosseum almost as close. Easy to get to all the main sites. Worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Rome from”
Reviews.Author: andyemily
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor, and were impressed by the reviews. The hotel is extremely well located. It is about 5 minute walk from the Colosseum, and maybe 10-15 from the Trevi fountain. You could walk to most of the main sights, although we took the tube to the Vatican mainly due to the pouring rain! There is a tube station about 50 metres from the hotel if you don't want to walk everywhere. The rooms were slightly small, but we were in the middle of Rome, and many of the other hotels in the price bracket had similar issues. We paid extra for the superior room, which had its own mini-terrace, which would definitely be good in the summer. The rooms were clean, and the shower was good. There were no tea or coffee facilities in the room, but there were tea and coffee making facilities in the lobby/seating area during the afternoon. The breakfast was very good. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way and very small.”
Reviews.Author: Dajecot
Reviews.Content: The people at reception were great. They were very nice and helpful. The breakfasts were very good. We felt our room was extremely small, the bed was very hard, and the shower was tiny. While the hotel is very close to a metro stop, making it convenient for trains, I think we will look for a better location when we return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, for Rome”
Reviews.Author: eahearn
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, but a little small, but I think the size of the room is typical of Rome. Location is good - very near the Coliseum, St. Peter in Chains, etc...Staff is attentive and helpful. Hotel is quiet. Breakfast was decent. We had two rooms - a standard double and superior triple. The triple was quite a bit larger and had a much nicer bathroom. It might make sense to upgrade to the superior, if you care about these aspects. All in all, a good hotel, which is difficult to find in Rome - quiet, near many major attractions and others can be walked to or you can take Metro or cabs, clean, helpful and friendly staff, reasonably sized rooms, reasonable prices (for Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern rooms in great part of town”
Reviews.Author: bullyboy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for only one night between flights. We really enjoyed the location of this hotel. It was close enough to the Colosseum but the streets didn't feel flooded with tourists. There were many locals out and about. Having never been to Rome before and only looking at maps I thought things were much farther apart from each other. I quickly realized that you could get around much quickly walking than I had expected. I was pretty overwhelmed with all the activity of the city. We took a cab to the hotel from the FCO Airport it took about 45 minutes with some traffic on the way for about $40 Euros. Going back the hotel called a cab for us and it was $46 Euro due to more traffic on the way out of town in the morning. The rooms are very small and clean. We had a room on the street but the noise was not an issue. They had 2 locking glass windows that kept the sound well insulated. The breakfast buffet was my wife's favorite during our 2 weeks travels through Croatia and Italy. Maybe that was due to it being our first stop on our trip and she was enjoying the fresh meats and cheeses. I thought they had a few more options than most of the hotels we stayed at but otherwise it was about the norm. I got very good at eating yogurt and granola in the mornings to get me through the day. The service was excellent and everyone at the front desk spoke excellent English. I'm glad we made the trip into town and stayed here instead of just staying at the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location & Great staff”
Reviews.Author: princess67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week at tthis hotel after it was recommend by friends. Had room on 4th floor , small but well decorated, very clean, modern ensuite, flat screen tv and little roof garden. All rather cute! Great location down a side street away from the hustle and bustle but close to all the main sights and to be fair everythig is walkable even the Vatican. Staff could not do enough and were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Recommended a great little restaurant a few streets away La Carbonara - fab food and very popular with the locals. Used the hotel taxi back to the airport - great service. No complaints at all and will defintiely stay here again. Thank you Max and all the otehr staff for making our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Outstanding staff.”
Reviews.Author: Edward1980
Reviews.Content: The staff of this place is just outstanding!. Great location, clean, excellent breakfast. The only draw back is the bathroom shower are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Petbe
Reviews.Content: The standard is more of a 3-star than a 4-star hotel, but the rooms and bathrooms are quite modern. The area is really terrific, near the subway, near the Colloseum and with lots of bars and restaurants. To walk around at night is no problem, it feels like a safe neighbourhood. Warning! Don´t leave any leftovers in the room or you will experience an ant-invasion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel room but the bathroom is tiny.”
Reviews.Author: woodytex
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week long vacation with hubby and infant. Hotel is in a really good area near Monti/Cavour Metro station. Staff are very accommodating and will try to help you navigate the city. Continental breakfast provided every morning from 7a-10a. Delicious. Room is medium sized but the bathroom is tiny in comparison. Did not provide hair conditioner or lotion. TV channels are hard to navigate so we watched alot of CNN-World. We had a queen/full size bed made of two twin beds attached to each other so it was not the best sleep I've ever had-doable but not great. Friendly staff members make up for the bed not being the most comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dudeinlosgatos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duca D’Alba hotel recently for several nights. Here’s the lowdown. Good: This hotel is in a great location and cool neighborhood for tourists yet isn’t in the middle of a tourist nightmare like the Spanish Steps or Vatican. You’ll see lots of locals in this area. One half block walk to the Cavour Metro station which is very convenient. The Monti neighborhood is full of quaint shops, good restaurants and narrow cobbled streets. The Coliseum and Forum are only a ten minute walk and one block away is one of the best churches in Rome, Santa Maria dei Monti. I was out late several nights and felt it was a safe area unlike the area around Termini. Next door is a good restaurant, an Irish pub is across the street if you long for some English conversation, and the pastry shop nearby sells the most amazing cannoli and pistachio gelato I ever tasted. Hotel main areas look like they do on the website. Breakfast was very good with an assortment of pastries, breads, cereals, eggs, bacon, juices, fresh fruits, meats, salads, and incredible cappuccino. Breakfast was included with my room. Hotel staff were very friendly and spoke English which was helpful. I was given a warm welcome. There is a laptop guests can use for free which was a nice service. An iron is downstairs in the gym. Room / Mixed: I was disappointed with my room. I had booked a single room and it was tiny and not chic like the pictures on the website. It was definitely NOT a four-star room by any American standard. The bed was a European single which is narrower and shorter than an American twin. A tall person (I am 5’, 9”) would have had to roll the bed out from it’s alcove as my fee just touched the wall. The bed was very comfortable however and had nice linens. The drapes were also very nice and the room was spotless. Ceiling was high. The bathroom was very nicely appointed in marble with bidet, sink, toilet and shower. Obese people would have trouble in the bathroom shower as the stall was very small. Europeans are not obese like Americans so some Americans would have issues with this bathroom. My disappointment with my room disappeared when I opened my windows and heard a singer performing for the diners below. It was like something out of the movies. There was a double set of windows which was great for soundproofing. The only place to sit in the room was on the bed or a tiny stool under the mini desk. There was a mini bar which was handy and inexpensive. I did ask some other travelers staying in doubles if their rooms matched the pictures on the website and they said they did. A local man I spoke to said his parents stay there when in Rome and he thought other rooms were very nice. Another issue I had with my room was an intermittent buzzing coming from the electrical outlet that was really annoying when I was trying to sleep. On the flip side, I got a good rate for my room so overall I had mixed feelings about room value. I also stayed at the Hotel Veneto and it was truly fantastic for the same price. My single room there was huge with a king sized bed and looked like something out of a palace but the neighborhood was not as cool. I posted a review of that hotel as well. Bottom line is whether I would recommend Hotel Duca D’Alba or stay there again. I would say yes to both but would upgrade my room next time around. P.S. Make sure you look into the Roma Pass. For three calendar days you get unlimited metro and bus use with a convenient card you swipe at the turnstiles plus three admissions to sites or museums (except Vatican). You also get to jump the line which was awesome at the Coliseum. Price was 28 Euros. Buy them at tobacco stands.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtf100
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly hotel, very central location within walking distance to the Collosseum. Rooms were small but modern and comfortable, service exceptionally friendly, and the breakfast decent. Modern & clean bathroom, perfect air-conditioning, room was quiet. We will stay there again. Room charges were very reasonable for Roman standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VeOl
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Rooms rather small, as you expect in a central Roman hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hostile staff. Awful experience. Moldy single room made me sick for 2 days.”
Reviews.Author: jpin86
Reviews.Content: During a 3 month trip to Italy and Spain, I stayed in 31 hotels and B&B's. This was the worst by far. Though the double room I stayed in my first night was perfectly acceptable (yet grossly overpriced considering the damaged walls and furniture), the single room I stayed in the second night was a traumatizing nightmare. Because this was my only my second night on my first trip traveling by myself, I was stupid and inexperienced enough to think that 65 euros for a stuffy closet was a steal. I also made the mistake of trusting the 4 star rating to book the room before inspecting it properly. Later, to my horror, I found copious amounts of black mold in the bathroom and behind the door to the room. Even after wiping it from the walls, the air was sickening, inciting a cough with nearly each breath. Closer inspection revealed that not only was mold on the surface of the walls, it was also growing in the cracks. In some areas in fact, these seemingly innocuous cracks penetrated the entire thickness of the wall, allowing slivers of light to pass through from the hallway. There was so much mold in these walls, that after sleeping there for one night (4 hours only with the help of a large, last-resort dose of ambien), I was sick for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: pambrinck
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff is very friendly, and all speak English. Would definitely recommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, good location.”
Reviews.Author: dera1995
Reviews.Content: A very nice small hotel within a walking distance from many major attractions. Hotel staff was very very friendly. Rooms are smallish but typical for smaller Roman hotels. Beds can be a bit on the hard side, but that might be more of a personal preference. The only thing I can complain about is the Campari Soda found in the minibar, that was hideous!

Reviews.Title: “New style - old Rome”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel between 18 and 21 Nov and the whole experience was very pleasurable. From the moment we checked in the staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. Rooms are not large but well appointed. Beds quite hard though which may not suit some travellers. We stayed in the annex which is virtually next door to the main hotel but is over a very well used restaurant (used by local Romans so this tells you how good it is) and some kitchen noise could be hear in the bedrooms. The passageway up to our room had an old (ancient!) water fountain on the wall along with an old statue in an alcove. Made us feel very in touch with old Rome. Our room had no outlook so quite dark at all times of the day but as long as you don't live in the room it wasn't a problem. The main hotel rooms may have more of a view to the outside world. Breakfast is plentiful and good and again the staff were eager to please. The hotel is just ten minutes stroll from the Colosseum and when standing in the hotel doorway you can see the Cavour metro station entrance which was perfect. The road in which the hotel is situated is a single track road, very old but which is filled by small businesses mainly catering for a local trade (scooter repair workshop just a few doors up) and has a great ambiance about it with small grocery stores vying for window space with designer boutiques. Plenty of interesting restaurants in the area not charging the exorbitant prices we were forced to pay close to the Vatican City or the more trendy areas around the Pantheon. This is not luxury hotel end of the spectrum but great value and the smiling staff alone would make me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value in Rome: take superior room”
Reviews.Author: JackSko
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 8 days and have had an absolutely great time. We have booked a superior room and were somewhat cautioned about the size of the room, but no concerns there. We got a good size room with a separate corridor and a walk-in closet! Double glazing, no problem with noise. On Friday and Saturday there were outside parties in the Irish pub next door: never heard a thing when windows closed. Staff all over very friendly and knowledgeable, well-spoken English. Free wireless Internet! Breakfast with lots of fresh vegetables and fruit which is rare. Location in the Suburra which was ancient Rome poor district, now it is Trastevere without the tourists. Great restaurants in the area, best of which is Osteria Suburra down the road: dirt cheap, great food. More upscale places there as well as Restaurante Giglio opposite the Opera. Forum Romanum, Colloseum within 10 minutes walking distance. We were sad to leave this great city and that hotel, and would return any minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave4377
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September and had a terrific stay. The room was quiet and comfortable, the location was terrific (we walked almost everywhere in the city), and the hotel staff were very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Delighted with Duca!”
Reviews.Author: AerospaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: In summary, this has got to be one of the best kept deals in Rome! - Stellar location just a few hundred meters from the Metro; walking distance to the Colosseum, on a quaint little cobblestone street. - Free wifi, complimentary breakfast (and I mean REAL breakfast for big American appetites) with paninis, eggs, fresh fruit and an abundance of coffee. - Great food, shops, and pubs literally right outside your door. - Fascinating, retro-meets-classic interior decoration. - Rooms feature flat-screens, nice appointments, very modern showers. My stay here was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and great location”
Reviews.Author: JNRICE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly situated,  just being 2 minutes walk from a metro station which is one stop from Termini (main railway station). It is also only a 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum (fantastic to see backlit at night time). There are also some great restaurants and bars a short walk away.  And buses for the Vatican and other attractions are only 10 mins walk away too.  The hotel is comfortable and well furnished, and the rooms sound-proofed for a great nights sleep. Breakfast is a varied buffet. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, and there is a laptop for free internet access. We would stay here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing..”
Reviews.Author: BergenNorwayJog
Reviews.Content: just got back from Rome 5 day stay @ Duca Dàlba.. superior service, stayed in a standard double room 4th floor . room was exellent also with a outdoor terrasse. the people who work there are the best. breakfast was very good, the mini bar was nice priced. good restaurants nearby.. Irish Pub across the street... short walk to forum, collesseum, and venetian square., also used the subway to vatican city & Piazza popolo, walking ditance to patheon.. Trevi .. spanish steps..would def. stay here again. free internet worked fine...used the limo service from the hotel.. this cost 60 euro from the airport & 45 euro to the airport. about 25 min drive . The Taxi cost 40 euro... so go for that..we had 32 degrees every day, lovely city..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: tatimiss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The location was great, the staff was nice and the room was clean and updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: lizziegirl255100
Reviews.Content: I loved it here! The collesseum is 500m down the road, you have the train station that will take you to the Vatican 20m away (can't hear any trains though!) and it is a short walk from Termini. The staff were incredibly friendly and sent us a complimentary bottle of wine as it was our honeymoon! The room was quite small but it was all we needed as we were out and about so much. At first the bed seemed quite hard but it was actually a great nights sleep. Bathroom was large but a tad grubby around the spa bath but overall the hotel was great. Very central to all the sites and for a Rome hotel it was bang up! A great breakfast too with sensational fresh fruit and the nicest waiters I have come across. We want to stay there again for sure - it was AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, free wifi, but hard beds”
Reviews.Author: travelingmike167
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for sightseeing, Got to hotel early and the room was not yet ready, but they stored our luggage and got us a map, codes for wifi, and we were off and running. After some touring and lunch got checked in and they had already brought our bags up to our rooms. The elevator here is ridiculously small (4 people were very cramped), but worked fine. Rooms were small by US standards, but typical for Europe. There were 4 of us in 2 rooms, my friend and I had twin beds with a good sized bathroom with a tub. The couple with us had a double bed with a bathroom with a very small shower only. AC worked awesome and was a welcomed relief from the Roman heat. Rooms had a small fridge as well. Wfi required login code from front desk (individual codes per guest if you both want to use at once) and connection speeds were good. The beds were very hard, otherwise I have no other complaint about the rooms. Location is great. It is very close to the metro station, and within walking distance to most of the big sites in old Rome. Staff were friendly and gave great directions to the sites and a few good places to eat. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: donut1983
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location; it is located one block off of Via Cavour and only about 5 minutes away from the Cavour Metro stop so it provides an excellent jumping off point to explore Rome. The hotel was clean, the staff was helpful and the included breakfest was an unexpected treat. The room was somewhat smaller than other hotel rooms I have stayed in, in Italy but I would not let that discourage you from staying here. The rooms had large HD televisions, air conditioning and a mini-bar that was affordably priced. The staff provided assistance above and beyond what I expected and the Hotel is located on a street with a number of fantastic restaurants. I would definitely recommend staying here with a spouse and/or partner but would be a somewhat more hesitant about staying with smaller children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdjohns84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for a long weekend trip to Rome in the standard double room, the room was big and clean with a small but nice bathroom, it was a very comfortable stay. The breakfasts were very nice and got our mornings off to a good start. You can see the metro station from the hotel entry and can be anywhere in the city in 5 mins, walking distance to the Colosseum and many other attractions with some very nice spots for lunch/ dinner just around the corner from the hotel. Will definitely book there next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: gaelgeoir67
Reviews.Content: Having read the very good reviews in advance of booking I was very disappointed with the hotel. My twin room was cramped with no room whatsoever between the 2 singles, I had to squeeze past my bed to gain access to the room. I could sit up in the bed and open the door as I had to several times, as they only gave one access card to each room.The shower / bathroom was ridiculously compact . The air conditioning was primitive and noisy necessitating opening a window over the staff smoking area and noisy kitchen entrance. My friend and his wife cajoled a move from his room due to excessive noise at the front and also as his wife requires the use of a bath for medicinal reasons only to be moved to a smaller room with a miniature type bath. The breakfast was appalling despite prompts and complaints from my friend and myself separately. From Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: vanewlyweds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Duca D'Alba for three nights. The service at the front desk is exceptional and everyone speaks English if needed (evening receptionist, Anna, is delightful). The rooms are small (to be expected in the city and in such a great location) but very comfortable and modern. We took a cab to and from the train station and a private car to and from the airport, in all instances, well worth the reasonable cost. Ask the front desk to assist with setting up transportation. The Hotel is minutes from great restaurants and less than a 5 minute walk from the Colesseum- cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: edwardsjbe
Reviews.Content: My 16 year-old son and I stayed at the Duca d'Alba for a week from March 14-20, 2010 for a Spring Break "Dad-Kid" trip to see the sights in Rome. I've stayed at this hotel three times now and have found it to be quite satisfactory. The price is moderate by Rome standards and the rooms are reasonable size and very clean. The staff all speak English fluently and could even understand "Texan." (We're from Houston.) Everyone we had any contact with was very kind and helpful and easy to deal with. I asked for assistance in setting up a day trip to Naples and Pompeii and, on another occasion, I needed some help with arrangements getting to the airport (Fiumicino). Both times the folks I was dealing with were very helpful and really went out of their way to go the extra mile, offered me alternatives, gave good advice, etc. One of the best things about this hotel is the location. It's not far at all from the Colosseum/Forum area and very, very close to the Cavour Metro stop. This makes it very convenient to use this hotel as we did, as a base of operations for touring and sightseeing Rome. Right across the street (Via Leonina) from the hotel is a great little genuine Irish pub called Finnegan's. I highly recommend stopping by there an evening or two for a cold beer. Friendly place. Just down the street is a gelateria with the usual great selection of good Italian ice creams and sorbets. If you sleep through the hotel's morning breakfast (which they were serving until 10 am when we were there) there's a small bar across the street where you can get some fresh-squeezed orange juice, coffee, and a breakfast pastry to start the day. In the evening, you can get a sandwich there or, just a few steps down the street is a pizza by the slice place called Pizza Leonina. A bit further down, on the corner of Leonina and Sepenti, there's a restaurant called "Wanted" that's pretty good, not great. But, if you're interested in great Roman pizza, get the front desk staff to give you directions to a pizza place called "Grazie a Dio e Venerdi" (Thank God It's Friday!) Pizzeria that's about a 4 minute walk out the front door of Duca d'Alba, at the corner of Via dei Capocci and Via Clementina, a bit up from the Cavour Metro station. If you're coming to the hotel on the Metro from Termini, the main train/subway station, it can be a bit confusing trying to locate the hotel for the first time. At Termini, you catch the Blue Line of the Metro and you go in the "Laurentina" direction. You only go one stop from Termini to the "Cavour" stop, which is where you get off to go to the Duca d'Alba Hotel. But here's where it can be a bit confusing: When you get off at Cavour, when going in the Laurentina direction, you come up some stairs from the subway stop and you find yourself up on Via Cavour. The hotel cannot be seen, as it is down below on Via Leonina. So, what you do is look for the stairs down to the other side of the Cavour Metro stop. That's the side you would exit if you had been heading in the opposite direction, the "Rebibia" direction. You cross Via Cavour and take the stairs down to the right. This puts you at the Via Leonina level and you just put the Rebibia Metro stop at your back and walk about 100 yards to the hotel. I know this sounds confusing but it sounds worse than it is. In summary, when you get off at the Cavour Metro stop, if you've been going in the Laurentina direction, then come up the stairs. The stairs split but it doesn't matter which way you go, left or right, up the stairs. This puts you out on Via Cavour. Look downhill and put the Metro stairs to your back. Off to the right front about 20 yards you'll see the Metro sign near some stairs. Cross Via Cavour and go down those stairs. This puts you at the Metro stop at the bottom of those stairs, which is at the end of Via Leonina. Just walk down Via Leonina about 100 yards and there's the hotel. Breakfast at the hotel was a nice surprise. It's served in a lovely room. They served from 7 am to 10 am when we were there. It included bacon and scrambled eggs, as well as a nice assortment of cereal, juices, breads and pastry, cold meat and cheese, as well as coffee, tea, milk, etc. I highly recommend this place. The price, for Rome, is right; the location is great; the people are very nice and helpful; and, the rooms are very clean and not too small. They're not big, but not too small.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel, location, service & price!”
Reviews.Author: swelch06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of January. We loved it! The desk staff spoke English, were curtious and remembered our names. The breakfast was very good and there is a delicious pastry shop steps from the hotel's front door, Ciuri Ciuri. We were very close to the Colosseum and the Cavour terminal for the Metro. Our room had a darling patio that had pleasantly large doors we could open for fresh air. We enjoyed our stay very much! The bathroom was nicely decorated in marble and stone and was kept clean and well stocked. The showers are small, as in many European bathrooms. The clothes line in the shower was very convenient to dry things on after our showers. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: BritinEgypt10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights 2 days. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The location is perfect 2 mins walk to the metro at the end of the road, 10 mins walk to the Colosseum and very nice restuarants just around the corner. For those of you that are smokers there is a smoking room downstairs where you can sit and watch TV whilst relaxing after a long sightseeing day! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome, its clean,comfortable and easy to get anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - superb hospitality, great location...”
Reviews.Author: KJAJ1
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot with our children and are fussy; hate too much corporate stuff, hate it where you feel you are in someone's home.....so the Duca d'Alba was a delight for us, the best of both worlds. On a practical note the family suite was stylish, cosy and comfortable, telly and internet all that it should be. On a personal note the staff were so friendly and helpful bringing us cups of tea when we were tired from loads of sight-seeing. Every request was met with good humour from corkscrews to heating fixing (us being stupid.) The hotel is in a friendly local neighbourhood and this is reflected in the restaurants nearby. We tried several restaurants on Via Leonina and nearby Via Panisperna, all good. La Cicala e la Formica was my winner, art work aside. Forum and Coliseum 5 mins walk and easy walk/metro to most other places. Oh, and I must mention the breakfast, for those whose experience of Italian hotel breakfast is a bit of stale cake Duca d'Alba excels with bacon, eggs, a panini machine, capuccinos.......fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Duca D'Alba offers everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: BubblesNC
Reviews.Content: The Duca D'Alba offers an elegant respite from the busy streets of Rome. Its central location near the sites of Ancient Rome provides easy access to the entire city, but it is far enough off the beaten tourist path to avoid overly crowded and noisy streets. During our eight-day stay we had the option of walking, taking the metro or a short taxi ride to and from everything we wished to see. It is true that some of the rooms are small, but most of them are larger than those in places we have stayed in New York City. Located in an old building, the public areas have been restored with a loving touch. Stone arches, inlaid wood and tile floors and classic themed art provide the place with a sense of history and the rooms themselves have simple touches of elegance. Furthermore, the rooms are quiet (new double windows), with comfortable beds offering freshly ironed sheets everyday, reading lights, a roomy clothes cupboard with mini bar and safe. The baths, though small, have counters, bidets, rain and hand held showers, oversized towels, robes, slippers with Hermes toiletries. As senior citizens, we appreciated the small, but useful lift. A bottle of wine is provided as a "welcome" gift. The breakfast buffet was ample and the front desk service cordial and helpful. The only thing missing was a comfortable chair. Note: The hotel is still in the process of restoring all of the rooms so it would be best upon making a reservation to request a "surperior" room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fantastic hotel, Incredible Staff...cannot say enough good things about our stay at Duca D'Alba!!!”
Reviews.Author: wchelm
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and Hotel Duca D Alba made this vacation such a pleasure for us! We chose the hotel because of it's central location in the heart of the city center, because of the good reviews it received on tripadvisor.com, and because of it's affordable price for it's star rating. The hotel's photos of the rooms online looked very appealing too. I was a little wary that in reality the rooms would not live up to our expectations but was pleasantly suprised. Although being a little small by American room standards, the rooms were excellent and lived up to their representations in the online photos. the location could not have been better in our eyes. The hotel is located in the heart of the city, in a wonderful neighborhood along a quite street. Great night life is right outside the front door of the hotel in every direction. The Colosseum is a short walk away and the Via Cavour Metro station is within eyeshot of the hotel's front door, from which you can reach any corner of the city. They provide free wireless internet and an excellent breakfast to fuel you up before you begin your daily adventures in Rome. That alone makes the room fare worth the price. I guarantee you would spend a minimum of $30 Eu for breakfast daily in a restaurant. In the other Italy hotel we stayed at we had to pay $10 Eu per day for our internet access. On top of all this, the staff at Duca D'Alba is amazing. Kudos go out to Anna, and Elisa and everyone who made us feel welcome in a strange city on our first day. The entire staff knew us by the second day and always greeted us by name. Thank you all for a great stay in the eternal city! We will not hesitate to book our next stay in Rome at Duca D'Alba.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: angels1five
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything the positive reviews said it would be. The staff were helpful and attentive, even finding out where my husband could buy tickets for the football the evening before the game (the answer is the tobacconist on the corner of Via Leonida and Via dei serpenti). The common areas of the hotel are very nicely done and spotless. Breakfast was a feast of just about anything you could desire, from eggs and bacon to cold meats, cereals, fruit, pastries and croissants, toast and preserves. The room was small but perfectly formed with a wooden floor and a six foot bed. Extra pillows were brought when we asked and I can honestly say I had the best nights sleep I've had in many a long night. The room overlooked the little piazza and was triple glazed so very quiet. The bathroom was great, all spotless marble and designer shower. Toiletries provided gratis. There was also air conditioning, but we didn't need it. A well stocked mini bar and TV was also provided. Two small things that would have made my stay 5* would have been a drawer for my smalls (only hanging space and shelves) and a kettle so I could brew up in the room, but these really are small niggles. Cavour metro stop is within sight of the hotel but you can easily walk to the sights from the hotel. Central but quiet. Perfect! I really can't recommend this hotel highly enough and no, I'm not related to the owner!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - Definitely not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Blondiesue
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome in October with my Partner. When we got to the hotel it seemed nice and the receptionist was very pleasant. We got our room key and was guided out of the hotel to the 'Annex Building'. It was like an apartment block with no carpet on the floors or paint on the walls. What seemed like the hotel bought additional rooms outside in another building. It was awful. The rooms were VERY small with a lot of moscito's, which my partner got eaten alive! The breakfast was not great either, very poor choice. Value for money = Definitely not! Only good thing was location as it is very near the Coliseum.

Reviews.Title: “great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoyceinNY
Reviews.Content: modern boutique hotel in an old building in a real neighborhood of rome, very narrow cobblestone street..location convenient to metro, local restaurants which are very good and cheaper then ones near the tourist attractions., we walked to all the historic sites..great location for that. room was small but well equipped, lots of nice touches. Breakfast was definitely a step up..pretty room, real china and glassware, brkfst staff very hardworking. food was croissants/ pastries/muffins/ nutella spreads/ assorted breads/ pannini maker/ ham cheese/ italian cold cuts/ bacon and scrambled eggs/ hard cooked eggs and fresh fruit ( kiwis, melons, apples. tangerines). large upscale lobby, front desk courteous price paid was 188 euros per nite for each double room ( 2 rooms....ouch). Rome is not cheap

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Trekker13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights (three nights at the beginning of our trip and 1 night at the end) and enjoyed this hotel immensely. The metro stop located just 100 yards away was super convenient, the breakfast was great, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in initially in the main hotel was rather small, but well appointed and included a balcony. The last night we stayed in the annex and enjoyed a much larger bedroom and bathroom, but did have to use three different keys to get into our room and climb a couple flights of stairs (no elevator). Though the hotel sits within walking distance from the Coliseum, we didn't feel the area was overly touristy and had a lot of local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the metro and colosseum, small shower.”
Reviews.Author: Allie_Van
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few metres away the Cavour Metro station. Note however that it is only close if you are exiting the station and travelling in the direction from the Metro line "Laurentina" to "Termini" to " Rebibbia". It worked well for us as we were arriving from the direction of the airport. It you are arriving from the other direction, for example, from the main train station Termini, you will need to cross the street and go down some stairs to access the Via Leonina. The hotel is on a quiet street but still within walking distance to restaurants, the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. The room was small by North American standards and average but clean. The free standing shower was very small and did not drain well. Your body could end up touching the shower tiles because is was small but at least it was clean. Our room also had French doors going out to a small enclosed patio but we never used it as the patio area was not very nice. It was at the bottom of part of an inner courtyard where all you could see and hear were the ends of air conditioner unit jutting out of other suites and apartments in the area. There was also an electronic bug repellant which we never used or saw the need to use. The buffet breakfast was very good with bacon, eggs, sausages, an assortment of pastries, yogurt, fruit, juice, tea etc. They offer 3 hours of free wifi but they provide no computer at the hotel. We had some troubles signing in after the second night and they gave us an additional 48 hours of access which was more than enough for our stay. The wifi signal was strong enough to reach our room. All our interactions with the hotel staff were positive.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GiGiSoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Angelo & the staff here made our stay in Rome great! They went above & beyond what any concierge at the best hotels would have done. Rooms were great, small by American standards but roomy by European standards. The breakfasts were very good & even the other guests were friendly. You could tell that we all were very pleased with our choice to stay at this hidden gem. If you want to get away from the chain hotel & have a fabulous place to stay, Hotel D'Alba is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_F2
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel was very easy from Roma Termini Station as the tube station (Cavour) is one stop away and 200 yards from the hotel. The location couldn't be better with the Coliseum 5 mins walk away. Good breakfast and the service was excellent - would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Well_travelled52
Reviews.Content: This year was our fourth visit to the Duca d Alba. It is such a welcoming hotel, in a great location. The staff are always helpful and pleasant, on hand 24 hours. All the major sights can easily be reached on foot, the Colloseum is 10 minutes away. The hotel has recently had improvements, the breakfast room is now much more spacious and bright. we always find breakfast to be more than adequate, a good start to the day. There are many sensible priced restaurants in the area,so eating is never a problem. We visit Rome every year and would not consider staying in any other Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBM
Reviews.Content: Located few steps from Metro Cavour, five minutes from the Colusseum, close to lots of nice bars and restraunts and yet is just out of the "touristy" area of Rome. The staff were excellent. The front desk staff all spoke very good English and were happy to help with recomendations for enjoying our trip to Rome. From the moment we stepped through the door we encountered "old fashioned" courtesy and good manners. I would not hesitate to go back. If I had one tiny complaint it was that our room was on the small size, but it did not detract one iota from our enjoyment. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money! Perfect everything: staff, location, food, ammentities, etc.”
Reviews.Author: mkmmm118
Reviews.Content: The best kept secret in all of Rome with lots of local hidden restaurants all around where the locals eat. The front door is merely but a few steps from the Cavour metro which you can access 90% of the tourist spots from. Although we checked out in the morning, our flight wasn't until late in the evening. The hotel let us store our luggage with them and lounge around, and then phoned a taxi for us. To say the staff was helpful would be a gross understatement! The breakfast included meal was plentiful and fresh. My only complaint about this hotel was our length of stay...would have loved to of stayed much longer! As far as we're concerned, we'll never book another hotel in Rome ever again! We've found our favorite and are sticking to it.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: NaumCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in Italy. By now, we've stayed in four and will stay in one more. Location is central and convenient for exploring Rome. Hotel front desk staff is just superb. Angelo and Max helped us all along - to find tickets, make reservations, show directions, explain bus schedules and plan our days better etc. Room was clean and comfortable. Not very spacious, but OK. Mattresses are a bit stiff (this seems to be the story of all of the hotels we've been to in Italy so far). Breakfast - nice and filling. Cereals, fruit, cold cuts, eggs. Espresso and capuchhino too. Internet is wireless and signal was not very strong - two bars at the most. An amplifier could help. But it was free, everywhere else in Italy we're charged for Internet. Lots of stairs, yes. But they do have a small elevator, if you need to move your luggage. Expedia locator said 10-minute walk from Roma Termini rail station. It might be on a nice early morning if you're jogging. Walking with suitcases on Rome's narrow cobblestone sidewalks was quite a challenge. Plus risking breaking the wheels off the suitcases. The hotel is right next to the Cavour Metro Subway station - one quick stop from Roma Termini (which was VERY handy, btw). It would be helpful to post this info with the Hotel Location and Direction instructions. Another quick and cheap improvement suggestion - add a $30 shower curtain. The shower is only half-glass-walled and lots of water spill on the marble. Overall, we walked everywhere we wanted to from the hotel and felt really nice and welcome there the entire duration of our stay. We'd come back and stay there again without any hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dozias
Reviews.Content: We made it to Rome and found our hotel pretty easily. They gave great directions online and we were there in maybe 10 minutes. Apparently the people that have put reviews saying it is hard to find, did not follow the directions given. The hotel was very nice and the staff was extremely helpful during our whole stay. This room was one of the best so far in Italy. We had a cute little terrace and a full size tub, which was very exciting since most bathrooms are quite small and usually only have small showers. We also had a nice plasma tv even though you won't find many american channels. They also surprised us with a bottle of champagne on our first night since it was our honeymoon. Breakfast was the best so far with hot food as well as the regular pastries, etc. They also have a nice sitting area for breakfast. Recommendations: See a futbol game at the Stadio Olimpico. It took us a while to get there but it was a lot of fun! The Stadium is about 6km outside of the city center but the ride home was much easier. They had buses just outside the stadium and it took about 10-15 minutes to get to the hotel. Definitely contact Angel Tours and do the Vatican Tour and the Colosseum and Roman Forum Tour. They were fantastic! The guides on both tours were very entertaining and full of information. The church of Santa Maria degli Angeli was beautiful and worth the visit and you should also make sure to see the Capitoline Museums. Valentinos...a little tratoria near the hotel. The man at the front desk of the hotel reccommended it and we ate there more than once. Fabulous food and good prices!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman base.”
Reviews.Author: Hemmo_Lincs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first family trip to Rome, and Duca d'Alba was the perfect base for exploring the city. Slight apprehesion as we approached down a small side street, completely forgotten as we entered the hotel. Early April with ongoing (but not intrusive) renovations close to completion, I think this hotel is a litlle gem. Perfectly clean, depsite the work, polite very helpful staff, sufficient breakfast including fresh fruit every morning. Perhaps not the biggest place in town but rooms decorated to a good standard with aircon and simply a perfect base. Key sites are all walking distance, and metro close by. Cafe's, bars and restaurants to suit all budgets in most directions. Local streets lively on weekend evenings, but not loud or threatening, our ten year old boys loved it. Would go back tomorrow. Ian H + family England

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: sabrina12
Reviews.Content: This was an awful experience the room was not clean. The bed and bathroom were dirty and continued to be for the remainder of my stay. I did not feel comfortable, want so ever in this hotel. The website is very deceiving because the hotel does not look like what is on their website. The location was good but not worth it. Do not recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was nice, large room, terrible entrance”
Reviews.Author: Austin_TexasRedhead
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our last night in Rome as a bit of a slurge on our budget thinking it would be nicer. Room was decent size, bathroom was nice, but entrance was horrible, due to construction on the streets, and cab had to drop us off about 1/2 a block away from entrance and we drug our suitcases across a battle zone. Staff was less than cooperative and had a horrific wait for check in. Best thing I can say is they actually served a nice breakfast buffett, first time we had eggs, bacon, and the works for 2 weeks. Was conveniently located by Colosseum, Palentine Hill, and metro station, but area seemed pretty tough, wouldn't want to be walking alone late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt96
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the hotel staff! Mom & dad, grandmother & three teens stayed here over Thanksgiving.Excellent location, with fun bars, wonderful chocolate & candy shops, very Roman antique dealers, fancy & homestyle restaurants...you can not ask for more. except a metro nearby...oh! There's one two cobblestone blocks away! And the area is unequaled if your hope is to immerse yourself in old Rome. The Coliseum, St Peter's in Chains, the Forum...so much more. The hotel: super clean, excellent breakfast, cozy (ok small) rooms but comfy & clean and the staff is ever so helpful. The hotel has a lovely ambiance. It is a cheerful place. We will stay with the Hotel Duca d'Alba again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: makryuch
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!!! The Duca d’Albe hotel makes money no matter what! I made reservation with the Duca d’Albe hotel with arrival on 08/27/2008 and departure on 08/28/2008, only for one night stay. On 08/26/2008 Tuesday afternoon I had a flight from Chicago to Philadelphia to make connection flight to Rome, Italy. My Chicago flight was delayed for 2,5 hours because there was a major outage in the computer flight network system. We arrived to Philadelphia approximately 45 min later after my plane to Rome took already off. The only available flight to Rome was next day 08/27/2008. I could not possible be in Rome on 8/27/2008 to stay at the Duca d’Albe hotel! While I was in Philadelphia, I contacted the Duca d’Albe hotel asking them to cancel my reservation, explaining them my unfortunate situation. But they refused to do it for me. Their argument was that there is a 48 hours cancellation policy. My case was truly exceptional. This delay was something that I could not be in control of. They did not care that this was something that could not be canceled 48 hours prior to arrival. The Duca d’Albe hotel charged my credit card for $185.00 anyway. Because of this delay I had to cancel my other reservations and all other companies were really responsive to my situation. They did me a favor of either refunding money or not charging my credit card. Only the Duca d’Albe hotel took my money and kept it. So, beware, it could happen to you too!!!
