Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FastHelen
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel room in a hurry as the one our agent had booked turned out to be untenable. Hotel Duca D'Alba took us in at short notice, even though they could not promise us the room for the full time we were there but, in the end, they even managed. When you need a room with three single beds this does cut your options but we fell on our feet. Great decor, spotlessly clean, best breakfasts we had the entire time we were in Italy and best of all wonderfully helpful desk staff. The position could not be beaten, near the metro, and five minutes walk from the Roman Forum. After a very miserable first night in Rome Hotel Duca D'Alba made up for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KarenRobinson
Reviews.Content: This hotel perfectly adequate for any short stay in Rome. It would have been quite hard to find though had we not pre-booked transfers from/to Ciampino (€35 e/w and the best idea by far if only a short break). The hotel is quaint, rustic and is very clean (rooms, bedding, towels etc). It is situated in a kind of back street but, this only makes it more fitting to its surroundings! TIP--try and avoid rooms ending '06' as we had an awful view of a 10' x 10' square consisting of 4 concrete walls and windows all around right up to the top of the building about 5 floors high, hardly any sunlight at all, but, this turned out to be a blessing if honest due to the heat! The hotels is a 5-10 minute walk to the Colloseum and Forums, both of which are out of this world, a 15 minute walk to Termini Station (one stop on the underground, 'Cavour' which is a 2 minute walk and €1 for a 75 minute ticket). It is a15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and 20-25 minutes to the Spanish Steps. The rest of the sights can be reached by walking (in COMFY shoes!) but we found the best way to get around was to do the open top bus tour '110' from Termini Station, it cost €18 for 24 hours and €24 for 48 hours (the 48 hour ticket includes a trip to the Catacombs off the map). The 48 hour ticket we used all day long and did the tour both during the day and at night, 2 very different experiences. We also used the tickets as general transport too which was a godsend. Back to the hotel, the reception staff were very helpful and charming and remembered my name everytime I went there, the breakfast is basic, bread, cheese, ham, salami, muffins, scrambled egg, bacon drinks and fruit but, it is fine. Awesome coffee! Don't be afraid of using the bar in your room, it cost us €1.80 for a can of Coke, about the same price as in the shops. The hotel is small yes, but that makes it more personal and welcoming. There is an Irish pub right accross the alley which was a nice wind down at the end of a long day, there is a lovely pizza take-away place 2 minutes away on Via Cavour and supermarkets, souvenier shops and bars/restaurants are all easily within walking distance. We would stay there next time we go to Rome, no question. I will add photos asap.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: lewllew
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff are very friendly and very helpful with any request. I particularly like Danilo, tell him I say hello! Their English is superb, even the lady serving breakfast will understand what you're saying. It's easy to get to from Termini, about 10 minutes walk which is ok. The location is great for walking around the city, it's really easy to find your way back after a day out. It's so close to the Colosseo, and the forum is just up the road. Our room was reasonably sized, clean, with satellite tv and a good sized bathroom. The shower was very good. Our towels were replaced daily and someone came in for a tidy up in the day too. the window with shutters looked out upon the cobbled street and you could easily watch life go by from that side of the hotel. The interior of the hotel is nice, really well decorated. Breakfast was pretty basic but I could still fill up. Even as a vegetarian. There's meat and cheese of which I didn't partake, but there is a variety of sweet or savoury bakery products, including croissants and chocolate breads, as well as fruit and juice. The coffee is fantastic. There's a lovely little restaurant at the end of the road called Wanted. We ate their twice, no funny business, just good food at good prices. Round the corner is a more upmarket restaurant which serves good food, though they don't understand if you don't like Parmesan! Up Via Serpentini, literally 2 minutes walk away, is the most fantastic gelaterie. They have so many flavours and they're all divine.We found this to be better than any other in the city, and we tried a lot of ice cream. I can't speak highly enough of Duca D'Alba, we didn't know what to expect as we ordered the whole lot through Expedia, but we knew straight away we'd hit the jackpot. Stay here, and just as importantly, go to Rome, it's a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: TiborVA
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. It's easy to find from the airport...you can take a taxi for ~45 euros or take the train/metro. There are two options by rail. The first option is to take the Leonardo express from the airport to Termini station, then transfer to the Metro B line to Cavour. The other option is taking the FM1 (aka FR1) train from the airport to Ostiense, then transferring via the underground walkway to the Metro B line at Piramide. Cavour is the third stop from Piramide. We took FM1 because it was half the cost of the Express/Termini option (6.5 euros compared to ~13 euros). We were also traveling during off peak hours and not during tourist season, so the trains were not crowded. Also, if you are heading NE on the Metro B line towards Rebibbia, the Cavour metro stop exits onto Via Leonina, just a very short, direct walk to the hotel. If you are heading S/SW on the Metro B line towards Laurentina, the metro exits onto the East side of Cavour and you will have to walk up and over Cavour to arrive at Via Leonina (Via Leonina sits below the street level of Cavour). The staff at the hotel was very friendly. The breakfast was pretty good (bacon, eggs, bread, coffee) as well. The rooms were small, but normal for Europe. Our room contained a mini fridge, safe, and small balcony. The bed was very firm, but I had no trouble sleeping at night. The bathroom had a hair dryer and stand up shower. If you are in decent shape, you can walk to just about any location in Rome from this hotel, but the Metro will give you easier access to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, and Villa Borghese. It was amazing to walk to the end of Via Leonina and see the Colosseum in the distance to the left and the Church of Santa Maria ai Monti right in front of you. If you walk up up the steps next to the Irish pub, cross Cavour, then walk up another set of steps, you will be at St. Pietro in Vincoli. There is a Gelateria/dessert shop across from the hotel entrance (http://www.ciuri-ciuri.it/ciuriciuri.php). Just down the street from the hotel is a nice chocolate shop (http://www.labottegadelcioccolato.it/collaborazioni.asp) There are also many places to dine along Leonina, Cavour, Serpenti, and Panisperna. Piazza Madonna dei Monti (http://travel2.nytimes.com/2006/05/28/travel/28surfacing.html?fta=y) contains a cafe, market, and other eating establishments. There is also a grocery store on Via Cavour, just before the metro stop. We did not have any noise issues from the Irish pub (http://www.finneganpub.com/FindUs.htm) mentioned in other reviews, but we were on the opposite end of the hotel. Overall, we had an excellent time on our first trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Water&Salt
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after reading glowing reviews on tripadvisor. Contacted the hotel directly and got a good deal - a discount (only for cash payment) with a bottle of wine thrown in, which was nice. Reached the hotel in the early afternoon and it was stuffy. I do not know if this is a problem with their air-conditioning or just a common practice in Italy where they do not use much air con, cos alot of the shops/cabs do not on their air cons despite the heat. I booked a superior room, which was supposed to be more roomy and comfy, but it was really tiny. Bathroom is also tiny but still decent. Air con cannot be adjusted and bathroom stinks abit. Room was abit noisy at nite cos of the resturants/bars nearby. Location is great to view the ancient sights. We took a walk after dinner nearby and saw the Coloseum at nite, which was awesome. There's a roman bath ruins nearby too. Metro just right infront, Cavour station. Overall, decent for a night sleep, if you are not looking into something fancy. Staff is friendly and helpful but the chambermaid can be abit too familiar...she opened the door with just one knock, without waiting for a response.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Numberslady
Reviews.Content: Really great little hotel. In quiet street, very central and 10 mins walk from Termini station or 50yds from underground stop. Nice cafes very close that are very reasonably priced plus great icecream bar within 3 mins walk!! Rooms clean and breakfast very fresh and hot. Food constantly refreshed. Staff very welcoming, helpful and friendly. Definitely recommended to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great find--should be ranked much higher!”
Reviews.Author: NorCal-traveler08
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a month in Europe and I found all of our hotels on TripAdvisor so I thought I would share our experiences. Loved this hotel. Can't believe it is only ranked #103 on TripAdvisor. It has a great location to ancient Rome, rooms are small but clean, staff is excellent, breakfast was great. We were given a cash discount (160E) on our room. Close to Metro station and many wonderful restaurants. We stayed in two other Rome hotels which were ranked much higher on TripAdvisor and this was every bit as nice. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: janevett
Reviews.Content: After scrambling to find an hotel in the historic area that was reasonably priced for our trip to Rome in early April, we settled upon the Duca D'Alba. Previously we had stayed at the Forum and the Grand Hotel Palatino, so we knew and liked the area- we always liked to visit the Forum each day. Unfortunately, they now charge for the Forum, so that changed the personal landscape for us- now instead of going through the Forum to reach the Campus Martius (ghetto, river, Pantheon, etc. ) we now had to climb the Capitoline, go around the Palatine, or go around the Wedding Cake- but we still like the area. There were minor quibbles with the hotel, only minor. The elevator is tiny, big enough for only 2-3 people at one time. Water pressure in bathroom was not abundant. The beds were hard, yes, but we slept like babies. The hotel is spotless, the staff spectacular. Breakfast was very nice, a selection of meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, breads and pastries, and more than enough. Location was superb- go to the end of the street, turn up a block and you're at Via Cavour (and can see the Colosseum). The metro is at opposite end of street, a few yards up from the hotel. Probably the best pizza I ever had in my life was had at the restaurant right close to the hotel, go out the door, turn right and there's Vecchio Roma with it's bright red door. The pasta, I should warn you, was remarkably al dente, but the pizza, MAN!!!! Continuing past to the corner, on the left, is a restaurant called Wanted- weird name but great food. All of these, despite the death of the dollar, were reasonably priced. I would most definitely go back to this hotel, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very central”
Reviews.Author: Cath001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Italy and stayed at the Hotel Duca D'Alba from April 18-20. We used Rome as our launching point for our Italian holiday, and were pleasantly surprised at the value the Duca D'Alba provided in a city with many more expensive alternatives! The room was small but adequate and the breakfast ample. We were within easy walking distance to the Colleseum as well as the metro station which made for an excellent launching point to see all the sites. In our short 1.5 days in Rome we were able to cover everything we had planned to and more. My only big complaint was how loud the Irish pub is that is directly across the street. On the night of our arrival it was extremely difficult to sleep until the pub closed at around 1-2 a.m. despite the hotels claims of sound-protected rooms. Other than that we enjoyed our stay and will consider the Hotel Duca D'Alba for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Londonlover7977
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Duca D;Alba. It is very close to the Cavour Metro, so very convenient to all sights. We paid 190Eur. We took the train from the airport to the Termini station and then the Metro to Cavour which is one stop away. Very close to the Colosseum and Forum. My first stay we had a very small room with a good size bathroom. The second time we had a fairly big room with a small bathroom. Everything was clean. Hair dryers in the bathroom. Tv with CNN and I think it had the BBC. The breakfast was the usual fare of rolls, juices, cheeses, meats. We don't eat much breakfast so it's fine for us. Staff was very friendly especially Massimiliano. I don't know the name of the man who is on at night but he was there both times I stayed there and he's not very friendly. Not rude but just not friendly. Hopefully I'll go back to Rome and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreeceCosta
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights in a triple room wich was small but very clean.Staff spoke good english and the breakfast was adequate(nothing special but everything was fresh and the coffe was great). Hotel was very close to colosseum and the forum 5-10 minutes on foot and very close to a metro station which we didn't use because we walked everywhere(fontana di trevi,spanish steps,pantheon,piazza navona ,ancient rome etc)We only took a taxi to the vatican. we were very happy with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in OK location”
Reviews.Author: Geek2Go
Reviews.Content: Mrs. Geek and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in early April, and we were very happy. The hotel is located near the Ancient Rome area, including the Colosseum and Roman Forum. It is also steps away from the Cavour metro station, which made traveling to other attractions very easy. A location closer to the center of city (e.g., Pantheon, Trevi Fountain) might be better, but we did not find getting around an issue. We did have trouble finding the hotel when we walked back the first night, but the pouring rain and poor tourist maps were contributing factors. Our double room was on Floor 4 (5th floor for N. Americans) and it was the typical European size (small). The bed seemed to be 2 singles pushed together, which worked fine. The bathroom was particularly small, although it did have a long bathtub (no bidet). The small room did have a small, private, outdoor terrace at the back of the building. This was a wonderful place to sip wine in the evenings, and we even brought our breakfast up one morning. The service we experienced was excellent. We arrived at 10am from the train station and they had our room ready. We asked for extra pillows one night and wine glasses another, and they were brought to us within 5 minutes. Everyone we met was professional and polite. Geek factors: * there were ample power outlets available to charge geek toys * free wireless Internet is available, but you have to ask for the WEP security code. Ask when you check-in. The speed performance of the connection was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, comfort and authentic style at the Duca D'Alba”
Reviews.Author: Mattabesset
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times over the past 20 years and will continue to do so despite temptations to try a new place. It is a very charming hotel in a historic section of Rome that feels slightly off the beaten path yet is actually very convenient to major tourist attractions like the Colliseum and the Forum (and some lesser known ones). It has expanded over the years but still maintains the same "small inn" ambience and style that exemplify Italian elegance. So many hotels today are tending towards the trendy and splashy and they pretend to be luxurious but look closely and you will find everything made of cheap materials and fake stuff so the place ends up feeling like a chain hotel.that could be anywhere in the world. At the Duca D'Alba there is never any doubt that you are in Italy. Like many hotels situated in historic city centers, the rooms are not too large but if you can get by that you will find that what it lacks in space is well made up for in comfort and good taste and friendly staff. You only have to run your hands across the glistening travertine marble that surrounds you from head to toe in the bath to appreciate it. I have never gotten over the feeling that I discovered a wonderful secret when I found this place. t was the start of a love affair with Italy that has kept me coming back again and again for more of the real Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ants in our Luggage!”
Reviews.Author: DanielleWM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duca D'Alba on the first leg of our trip to Rome. With the cost of the hotel we were expecting something equivalent to the less expensive, but four-star hotels we'd stayed at in Venice and Florence, esp. based on the reviews here and on Expedia. But when we arrived, we were given a room in the Annex, which is a separate building that also has apartments. The bed sloped so that our heads were lower than our feet, and the shower was so small that the curtain stuck to our bodies when we showered. But the worst part was the ants! They arrived the first night in the bathroom, but the next morning after breakfast (I had already requested another room but the hotel was full), my husband found them in our luggage in our clothes! When I called the reception desk, the first thing he said was, "What can we do? The hotel is full." Not the most helpful service! He finally sent up a bellboy so we could at least take our luggage out of the room to be stored until a room opened up later that afternoon. They did move us to a better room in the main part of the hotel, and the night reception person apologized to us and even provided us with a surprise bottle of wine, but it definitely gave us a bad taste for the Duca d'Alba. As we were checking out, we noticed that they were removing doors from the Annex building, so hopefully they're redoing it, but until then, make sure they don't put you in the Annex! Also, the room we ended up in still was not the nicest room. The 47 Hotel near the Tiber, where we stayed our last leg, was only $25 (yes, dollars) more expensive per night, and was truly a four-star hotel. It was just as close to all the sights but so much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful second time experience”
Reviews.Author: tunein
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in this hotel after the good experience in our first visit. The location is perfect and makes you reach all interesting places in Rome which are not few. The rooms are adequate and very clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely choose this hotel if I happen to visit Rome again. Also one has to mention three restaurants I visited which are "La cicala e la formica" just outside the hotel. "Wanted" a few meters down the road and "Ristorante Tema" which is in Via Panisperna just a 5 minute walk from the hotel but surely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Airrun
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be extremely friendly and received excellent service. Staying here gave us a great feel for Rome - nice location. We had a balcony, which was much welcomed as we could sit out in the breeze with a bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “great value ... beware of the ants”
Reviews.Author: lilanne04
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. The service was excellent and the hotel staff are extremely friendly (they make it their business to remember your name). We arrived before check in time but were able to check into our room immediately with no problems. Each room has a different design but are all a good size and fairly cozy (the beds were a little hard for my taste). All rooms have a minibar, safe, and large closet. Some rooms have a stovetop and sink (ours didn't work) and either a standup shower or shower with bathtub. (see pictures) The continental breakfast in the dining room was pretty good as well. As stated by previous reviews, we didn't stay on the same side as the irish pub so noise was not a problem. Also, the room we stayed in was enclosed within a suite of rooms and since we were the only ones in that suite there were no noise problems. I imagine if there had been other people there it would be a different story (there is a lot of echo in the hallways). After we had come in from a day trip on the first the day, the desk in our room was engulfed with ants. The staff responded quickly and we were moved into an adjacent room within a matter of minutes (luckily we didn't have too much luggage). The next day was pretty much the same ... we came back to our room and found more ants. However, this ant problem wasn't as bad as the first so we stayed in this room. Once again, the staff was very quick to fix the problem. They also said that they normally don't have a problem with ants. Overall, the stay was pretty good. The location is fantastic ... you can walk to the colosseum and other major sites or take the underground which is only steps away from the hotel. The hotel desk can give you a map that shows u the major sites in rome. I will admit I am a little squeamish , and if the ant problem were fixed I'm sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Budget Gem”
Reviews.Author: fluzyflapper
Reviews.Content: Fourth return to Rome.Best Hotel to date by far .Thankyou Tripadvisor we now enjoy our hotels so much more.What a delight this one is. The bonus of 3 minutes from Cavour metro stop, and main attractions within minutes too,yet just back enough off the busy roads.A Bijou smallscale Hotel,but everything so beautifully decorated ,furbished and funished.Arrived early to be told our room was ready, which was a relief.Staff always helpfull here.Flew in at ten and was at the Colosseum by twelve.Breakfast 7 am to ten am ,and lots of quality choices in the delightfull breakfast area.No complaints here.We maximised our stay -everything was so convenient,loved the surrounding area with lots of great eating places (can recommend La Baraise/Argentinian on via Cavour)and interesting small shops.It may be budget but it is definately luxury budget here.If there is a room available this will be our future base on return trips.Roma pass currently E20.Can be sold out in busy spots.Tip: do Palatine/Foro area first ,you then have your tickets and can go straight to the way in at the Coloseum and avoid queues(it is a combined ticket for both).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in center of everything”
Reviews.Author: timbo01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to all the things you must see in Rome. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were great. Lots of good restaurants nearby and plenty of bars. We had such a good time that we will be returning in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of Charm”
Reviews.Author: 3JDM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Duca D'Alba in a Junior Suite in November for the first 3 nights of our trip. Liked it so much we came back for the final 3 nights of our trip.(After visiting Sienna, Florence and Venice). Considering how small the Hotels in Rome are, there was plenty of room for the 4 of us. You can't beat the location. Short walk to the Colloseum, Roman Forum and many other Ancient Ruins. Cavour subway station is one small block away and Cavour is one stop from Termini Station. Want to go to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain? Walk the one block to Cavour station, (B Line) pay one Euro, take the subway one stop to Termini, get off and swicth to the A line, get off at the third stop and you are there in about 20 minutes. It may sound complicated but it is easy, fast and inexpensive. Via Leoninne is a small little street that is kind of charming. There is a wonderful sweet shop next to the hotel that has great gellato. Many coffee bars (one across the street) and decent restaraunts (one next door) within a 5 minute walk. Also, there is a small grocery store, "Elite", 5 minutes away on Cavour where you can buy beer, wine and munchies. The staff was friendly and you can't beat the buffet breakfast that is included: Eggs, bacon, croissants, toast cereal and coffee. As far as the Irish Pub is concerned, our room was directly across from the Pub. Since the street is barely wide enough to get a car down it, I could have spit out the window and hit the place. Yes, it can get a little noisy when the younger crowd stands outside to smoke but as soon as we closed the airtight window, the noise was almost completely muffled. Since we were pretty much exhausted from the days activities we fell fast asleep. If you are looking for the Westin experience don't go here. If you are looking for something that has a superior location, a real "ancient Rome" feel and a great overall value, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Henrietta_Stackpole
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Duca D'Alba for one week. We started out in the annex, but the management requested we move to a different room (in the main hotel) half-way through the week. This hotel has exactly what we require: excellent location, comfortable beds and easy access to public transit. There is a subway stop a block a way, which is a one-stop connection to the main Termini station and express train to the airport. Also, a grocery store is just a block away. The neighborhood is not overly touristy, within walking distance of the Forum and Palatine hill. The morning to early afternoon desk manager was a bit annoying (he wasn't straight with us about the check in time and he made us switch rooms which took up valuable time), but the rest of the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: AmArty
Reviews.Content: This hotel located just blocks from the Colosseum was the best find in Rome. (we stayed in a B&B for the first part of our stay) It is located in a less "popular" section of Rome off the beaten path but the area is not touristy & less expensive. The room cost & all the restaurants were about 1/3 the price as around the tourist traps of Via Veneto(La Dolce Vita area) The staff was very gracious & knew you after the first day. The breakfast served was the best !!! Our room had an extra large whirlpool tub & that was a surprise!! If you go to Rome just stay here & don't look elsewhere. hunts of chicago

Reviews.Title: “Duca D'Alba has great value”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: I found the Duca D'Alba on Tripadvisor and decided to book it for 3 nights before we joined our Trafalgar tour in Rome. I found the reviews to be quite accurate. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean. The bed was little harder than what we are used to but we found the room quite comfortable albeit a little small. That is the standard in Europe and especially in such a excellent location in Ancient Rome. We were only a 2 minute walk from Cavour Meto Station and 1 kilometre from Termini train station. We took the train in from the airport (FCO) and it was very easy and inexpensive. We actually walked from Termini to our hotel,because we knew it was only 1 kilometre,but I wouldn't recommend doing that since we were dragging our luggage on some pretty old streets with a lot of bumps and holes.If we had been walking without luggage it would have been fine. It would have been wiser to take the subway just one stop over to our hotel. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs and bacon,croissants,fruit,cereals,coffee and was always very fresh during our stay. I would also recommend that you bring earplugs to sleep because if you get a room on the same side as the Irish pub,you will hear these people until they close the pub at 1:00 a.m. I can't fault the hotel for that,because there is nothing they can do to control the patrons that spill out onto the street. They are almost under your window,since the street(via Leonina )is so narrow.Also scooters pass by till all hours of the night. I think Rome is the other city that doesn't sleep!! The hotel has excellent windows to minimize the noise,but the pub kept me awake every night even with the shutters and windows completely closed..If you book ,ask for a room towards the back of the hotel away from the street and bring some earplugs in case you don't get the back side rooms. Never the less,we did enjoy our stay at the Duca because we were out walking and touring for those three days and spent very little time in the room. The value is fantastic. About $200.00 a night for a clean safe room with breakfast and only a 5 minute walk to the Colisseum and the ruins. There are several restaurants in the area,and you can walk to everywhere in Rome from that location. If all you want is a clean safe place to sleep while you are touring Rome the Duca can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: freberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Duca d'Alba for three nights in mid-August.. The original reservation was for a room with 4 beds (my husband, daughter, son and myself). When we arrived they told us the room would be too small to accommodate all of us, so they gave us two double rooms on the first floor (really the second). Athough they weren't next to each other, we were able to easily get from one room to the next. Because we were afraid of lost luggage on our way over to Rome (via Heathrow), we purposely split up our clothing in the event a bag might not reach us. So, not being in one room was a bit of an inconvenience, but we managed. The hotel staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. We did all agree that the breakfast served at the hotel was the best we had in Italy. My son, a very picky eater, loved the scrambled eggs, and never left the table hungry. The location of the hotel was great -- a short walk to the Colosseum and the other nearby ancient ruins, and a very nice stroll to the other areas of the city. We took a cab only twice -- once from the airport to the hotel and the other time at night when we were too exhausted to walk back from the river. Other than those two times, we did not rely on any public transportation. The only down side to the stay in Rome was the crowds, which we experienced throughout Italy. We often felt like ants, especially near the touristy areas such as the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Stay away from the restaurants on the big piazzas -- overpriced and not very good. There was a restaurant near the hotel, Wanted, that we ate at the first night in Rome that we thought was great. And right around the corner from the hotel is a place to get gelatto. Getting back to the hotel, yes, the rooms and bathrooms were small, but they were clean and adequate, and for the amount of time that we spent in the room, a great value. My daughter and I stayed in a room that faced the infamous Irish pub, but there wasn't much disturbance (only the first night did we hear music and voices, but it didn't bother me). I would highly recommend this hotel to people who want a clean, convenient and decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice and tiny”
Reviews.Author: Lasparky
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small. I mean, tiny. They were clean, but in need of soundproofing. We could hear a dog barking next door. Everyone there was friendly and helpful-when we asked for a larger room they gave us another small room, but at least it had a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MJF1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duca D'Alba for 11 nights and it was a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and spoke English very well. The room was very clean, comfortable, and the location of the hotel was excellent. We were within walking distance of the Colosseum, the basilica of St. Mary Major and the subway station was right down the street. We even walked to St. Peter's, the Appian Way and the Villa Borgese. The train station is also within a short distance (15 minute walk). The room price included breakfast each morning, which was excellent. The breakfast wasn't just a continental style, but included bacon and eggs, cereal, ham, fruit, yogurt, breads, muffins, etc. Coffee and juice were also included. The hotel was also air conditioned and each room has a small safe for your valuables. We can't say enough good things about this hotel and would stay there again if we ever returned to Rome. Trip Advisor Member, Gill, Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Loved Duca Dalba location”
Reviews.Author: Leonardtown_MDPaulk
Reviews.Content: Duca Dalba was a half mile from the colloseum and forum; Great location, very close to a Mail Boxes Etc. as well. Very convenient to couple restaurants and english pub; Staff was very helpful. While the room was somewhat small, the accomodations were very clean. Great chocolate shop, liquor store, deli and gourmet foods shops across the street. Definitely would stay here again and strongly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: normawahl
Reviews.Content: I had booked to stay 4 nights, but only stayed for 2. I specifically asked for a triple room, not a double with an extra bed stuck in it and was assured that would not be the case. The room was so small we could not open the bathroom door because they put a twin bed in front of it. Part of the twin bed was pushed under a desk and my 7 yr old son hit his head on it while in bed. The decor was very drab. I am a travel agent and have traveled extensively through Europe and this was extremely small and overprised even by Europe standards. The location was good however, and the breakfast better than average. I recommend you avoid this hotel, there are better ones out there.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5-Duca D'Alba”
Reviews.Author: KatyBelle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous trip to Italy! We are a family of 5, boys ages 11,9,7 and us, their parents. We spent 5 nights at Hotel Duca D'Alba in Rome. We had a family suite that had room for all of us!!! It was 250 Euro a night, Easter week. That felt like a bargain because most places required us to book two rooms! The room was crowded, but not terribly so. There was a single bed in the foyer area, which was a fabulous place for the boys to hang before my husband and I were ready to wake up. In the main room there was a double bed made from two singles pushed together, which was fine, no problems. A single was right next to that bed, but made up seperately. Across from the foot of the double was another single. There was also a big-ish closet that help all of our luggage and had ample space to hang clothing. The bathroom was big by Europe standards! The location was fabulous. We walked to the Coliseum area very easily. There were lots of shops and restaurants on the streets with the hotel. There was an ATM about a block away. Taxi rides from far away were about 6 Euro! Cheap for 5 people! There was a train station about a 1/4 a block away. Very, very, great location! Breakfast was exactly the same every morning, but fresh and yummy! Bacon, eggs, croissants, chocolate muffins, toast, yougurt, fruit, coffee, milk, juice. The staff was nice and helpful. Overall a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit Too Irish in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Honeytripper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and liked it. The rooms were very small, but the staff were friendly and the location handy to the Roman Forum. This time was awful, due to the noise from the Irish pub across the street. The pub sells liquor to people outside through a side window, so there were people standing outside and sitting on the steps drinking, talking, and making an incredible racket. We were there for St. Patrick's Day, and a rugby match between Italy and Ireland, and there was no escaping the nightly festivities. I would never stay there again, for fear of having to endure that noise once more. Outside noise is not unusual in Rome, but that was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Ebdublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10th - 12th March. Great location - found it very easily from Termini station & very close to Colosseum, Palatine & forum. Got off to bad start though as paid for room in hotel but they put us in "annex" building adjoining hotel - 3 large keys later & we were in a poky room in the annex building - what was worse was they never explained/apologised & we had to ring down to ask where we in the annex building & request a change of room. Having read previous reviews on hotel I deliberately booked room in hotel & not in annex so was not impressed. Eventually settled in room on 1st floor looking over small laneway/road facing irish pub across the road. Had been warned it would be noisy but at this time of year didnt need window open in room & noise didnt travel. Found room quite basic & decor a little tired but clean nonetheless. Didnt think much of the breakfast - avoid the eggs - dodgy for me. Would I go back? Dont think so - would like something a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: NJSteph24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Nov 1-5. It is clean with basic rooms. a great staff who remembered our room number and gave us a warm welcome every time we came back. My room faced an odd little interior courtyard, and if your windows are open, you can clearly hear others around you and water rushing through the pipesw. When they are closed, the noise is not an issue. We were even next to the elevator and it did not bother me. The breakfast buffet is nice, but esp nice is the cappuccino/coffee bar in the morning.. you can even get some liquor added to your drink if you would like. More importantly, it is a one minute walk from the metro, one station away from Termini. The Coloseum is a 5-10 min walk down the street. I felt very safe walking in this area, it is nice with tiny streets a some good pubs right across the street. We walked to all of the tourist attractions except for the Vatican and Trastevere (metro). In earlier reviews, I read multiple posts talking about a great restaurant next to the hotel- WANTED. We went, and it was the best meal we had on our whole trip, it cost about 30 euros for lasagna, salad, a small pizza, gnocci, 2 giant morretti beers, and the best tiramisu I have ever had. If you stay at Duca, you have to go here!!! If i ever go back to Rome, I will def. stay at this hotel again. It was a great trip

Reviews.Title: “If only they had internet”
Reviews.Author: smackmeister
Reviews.Content: Duca D'Alba was a cozy little hotel. And when I say little, I mean little. Our room was on the 4th floor and we had a wonderful little terrrace covered with vines and overlooking... well, an alleyway. But it was great having the little terrace. I like to smoke cigars so it was a perfect spot to do it. A better view would have helped but it was more than I was expecting. The room was very small though. My girlfriend and I had one large suitcase each, and there simply was not enough room. It made it difficult but it wasn't too bad. The TV was tiny but since I wasn't really interested in watching it, that wasn't that bad either. The breaking point for me though was the lack of internet. They don't have it which is bad for me since I'm an internet freak. We ended up moving to Hotel Rex a few blocks away, which had internet and bigger rooms (but no terrace).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, location and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AUMom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel...nice clean rooms, great bathrooms with big fluffy towels. Refrig and safe in each room. The staff is excellent. Angelo, Max, Danilo and Igor and the rest of the staff are so welcoming and helpful. The breakfast each morning is great. They even let us eat early when we had to leave early for a tour. Breakfast starts daily at 7 a.m. and if we had a tour pick up around that time, we were called to say we could eat early. Great location. You can walk to just about everything or catch the subway or bus. Great places to eat in the area also. Will definately come back to Duca D'alba.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Bournemouth_Flash
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the friday night , not overly difficult to find hotel if you have a map, First impression was good, greated well, taken to rooms in smallest lift in world.Rooms were clean but basic, bathroom was nice , however as i had booked the superior room was expecting more than what i got, so not sure what the standard rooms had. Mini bar telly thats about it. real dissapointment was the bed had contacted hotel direct and specified i would like a double bed and not two singles pushed together this was confirmed by hotel, so on arrival what did we get ...yep 2 singles pushed together, complained to reception only to get a very blunt we only have singles ....so that was real downside, breakfast was ok it surficed....major plus of hotel is location,, 5 mins from colloseum and forum, metro 2 mins away and only 4€ for all day ....as for rome what a city tottaly amazing loved it..not cheap by any means but definetly a great place , felt very safe , very relaxed definitely returning someday...but yes pricey for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Hugh_Mac
Reviews.Content: Arrived late 20.00 hr welcomed by friendlys front desk staff, porter brought to rooms. Good size room by Rome / EU standards, large double bed and cot. Mini fridge excellent for baby milk TV air con what you would expect. good windows very sound proof from noise below. Breakfast excellent meat cheese bacon eggs bread yogurt cereals etc.good and hearty sets you up for the day. Underground 50m away 10m from Via Carvor nice little restaurants around but watch where the Italians go to eat and follow there led. Good little spot I would recommend it for myself, wife and baby 18mts

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: The_Baileys
Reviews.Content: We've been to Rome numerous times, and this trip I thought we'd pay a bit extra and stay somewhere really nice. The hotel website, as well as a review I'd read in Fodor's, led me to believe this was the spot ! Our room wasn't in the hotel, but a few steps away. It wasn't a bad room (the bed was comfortable, and it was pretty clean), but it wasn't a great, or even good room for 170 Euros/night. It was small, and very, very bare bones. I do have to say the washroom was large and nicely re-modelled. The other odd thing was when it came time to pay, we tried to pay by credit card, but the guy at reception told us that the 170/night was a cash deal (though they never told us that), and if we wanted to pay by visa it would cost 195 Euros/night. Not a huge deal, just meant we had to get to a bank machine (and incur charges). The staff were friendly though, and the breakfasts were pretty good. All in all, not a bad place, but you can do better for the money. Hotel Aberdeen (which is virtually impossible to get a room at) is 135 Euros a night, and is great. We ended up staying at Hotel Medici. Close to Via Veneto, huge rooms, a bit run down, but nicer I think than Duca D'Alba, and 140/night. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, huge rooms for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lleya
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled, this has huge rooms for Roman, even European, hotels. And the bathrooms are to die for. Marble, full bathtubs, nice fluffy bath towels. The staff are very attentive and friendly, breakfast is good, it's close to an excellent grocery store (right across Via Cavour, the Elite). We had dinner on our last night at the restaurant right across the courtyard from the door, and it was by far the best meal we had in our two weeks. Also, if you're like us, you might want something other than Italian food, and there are a couple of very good Indian restuarants there. It's clean (always the most important), not hugely expensive, well run, and well situated. It's almost luxurious, but not quite. The Metro is right there. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: Bildo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duca D'Alba for three nights in late Sept, early Oct '06. The location is on a very narrow street in central Rome. You are about four blocks from the Coloseum and the Forum. Everything but the Vatican is within walking distance. Rome has a very underdeveloped train system, but there is a station a block away. The staff were very friendly and nice. I cannot stress this enough. I stayed in a room in the adjacent building. Like some other European hotels, you have to leave the keys with the front desk whenever you leave. If you aren't used to this, it can seem a little strange, but it really isn't a security problem. The room was larger than most European hotel rooms that I've stayed in. Even though I was traveling alone, I got a double room. It consisted of two twin beds pushed together. The airconditioning worked, but I'm not sure that it would be able to keep up if I were there in August. Even though it is on a tiny street, there are several restaurants, bars, and shops in the immediate vacinity. Between the two buildings that make up the hotel, there is an apartment building. When I looked out of the window, I was looking at people's apartments. I don't mean ten or twenty feet away, I mean three or four feet away. You heard people's dogs barking, kitchen noises, and other sounds typical of dense urban living. At night, they faded away pretty well. The bathroom was very large by EU standards, but there was a window in the bathtub/shower. I don't mean a tiny window, I mean a full fledged window (with no curtains or shade to cover it). The glass was semi-frosted. When I looked out, I was looking into an apartment's kitchen. Taking a shower during the day wasn't too bad because they couldn't see in, but at night, it wouldn't have left much to the imagination. It is a cute little boutique hotel, but for the price, I'm sure that there are much nicer ones in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L2santhanam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the duca d'alba in September 2006. We really loved this hotel. The location is about two blocks from the colleseum and very close to a metro. The rooms are really lovely they have your standard safe, A/C, tv, hairdryer etc. It is very clean!!! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was good. It is across the street from a great Irish bar. When you need a break from the wine. Also, if you take a right out of the hotel away from the Irish bar, and continue going straight there is a GREAT trattoria. The food is absolutly amazing and the desserts are even better. This place is close to the ICE bar. We'd stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “cute and friendly”
Reviews.Author: roopastarz
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect with this hotel, having read many mixed reviews. But it turned out to be a really cute place in a really good location. I recommend the balcony rooms because it helps open up the small rooms. The breakfast was better than expected (scrambled eggs, bacon, variety of meats/cheese), and the concierge were really helpful. We loved that it was so close to the Colliseum -- walked over to it every night after dinner. If we were further away, we'd have to make an extra trip at night just for the evening view. Spent most of the time out touring the city, so this hotel served its purpose. The main point is that it's a clean place to rest your head at night...and the location is really fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “I cried...but the tears soon dried up!!”
Reviews.Author: CJ-JB
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying I am not a drama queen, honest! but to start off with the taxi driver didn't even know where this hotel was. Then when we found it and drove down the back street, I was hoping we were lost!!! I must stress now though that I was very wrong in thinking this and the location of this hotel is fabulous, most of Rome looks like this area and because this was a back street, lots of graffiti etc I was slightly shocked to say the least!! Things got worse before they got better, but I must say that the staff at this hotel were brilliant, very polite and friendly and would go out of their way to help.....however, i seem to think maybe they didn't have any of their "best" rooms available because when I read the reviews on this site I can't compare the rooms we were offered ,to what people say, however I am thinking that the adjacent building people talk about houses the best rooms so ask for one of those where possible. We were given the option of two rooms to look at, the first one had a balcony but was tiny and I mean tiny so we looked at the 2nd room on offer, i still wasn't impressed but don't like to be rude so we settled for it...it was then the tears came!! I couldn't imagine why we had booked this hotel, we have travelled all over the world independantly and always research our stays very thoroughly, so I needed to see the reviews and website for this hotel. We went to an internet cafe immediately to try and book somewhere else but when I read the reviews for this place I decided it couldn't be "that bad" and it was just unfortunate that we'd ended up in a very outdated, dark room (the shutters on the outside of the window were chained together so you couldn't have any natural daylight). Anyway we decided to just "get on with it" and our trip to Rome turned out to be amazing....just be aware that not all the rooms at this hotel are as described or shown on the website but if you get lucky and get a great room then you couldn't ask for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely central hotel for all travellers”
Reviews.Author: The Teacher7
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my honeymoon, which included 4 nights at the Duca D'Alba in Rome. I'd previously stayed here with my parents some 12 years ago, but knew that it was centrally located and reasonably priced! My husband had told them that it was our honeymoon, so they "upgraded" us to a more private room in an adjacent building. It was of a decent size for the centre of room and the bathroom was gigantic - including a jacuzzi bath! They had also left a bottle of complementary bottle of spumante for us. Breakfast each morning was great with ham, cheese, croissants -both "normal" and filled with custard. Basically, a typical continental breakfast which sets you up for the day of sight-seeing. We had a lovely stay in Rome and were glad that we'd chosen the Duca D'Alba over other hotels in the same price bracket. My husband was overwhelmed by the proximity of the Colosseum as he loves the history of the whole Roman Empire and where better to immerse yourself than Rome! Just be careful, when in Rome, of pickpockets - especially on the buses and metro...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great part of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: sportennis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duca d'Alba is a wonderful small hotel on a very quiet street in Rome not very far from some of the great sites. The room was spacious and the bath room was large by European standards. It was very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was one of the best. They offered scrambled eggs and beacon as well as breads, cold meats, cheese, yogurt and cereal. Great way to start the day. Because the hotel is so close to the ancient sites there are many tourist walking along Via Cavour. Some places take advantage of the tourists so watch out for them. One place in particular is a "Snack Bar" Called Venezia. It is also a Tabacchi and is located right on the side of Metro Cavour facing Via Cavour. They have slick looking waiters ready to entice you to sit while they serve you 3 euros sandwiches and then charge you a table fee and service fee that is 4 to 5 times the cost of the sandwich. They will actually encourage you to sit with out telling you about the price difference. I got taken for. But their loss because I didn't go there again. There is a restaurant (pizzeria) right near the hotel called Le Vecchia Roma. Great food at very cheap prices. They have wonderful spaghetti 6 euros and fabulous mussells for 8 euros. Their house wine is 4 euros for a liter. These are honest people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Breakfast & Staff --- but Encountered Some Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: wspt
Reviews.Content: I took my three teenagers to Italy for Spring Break. Hotel Duca d'Alba is in a GREAT location for sight-seeing ---- a 5-min. walk to Collisseum, a 5-min. walk to St. Peter's in Chains & a 5-min. walk to the Roman Forum. I'd say it's a 3-star hotel by US standards. Decent restaurants and local shops within easy walking distance, and the Cavour Metro stop was about 50 yards from the hotel (although because of the "line" it was on, we often needed to take the Metro up one stop to Termini Station to switch to the other line which took us to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese & more... Note: We did a lot of walking and did not rely on the Metro that often. (Advice: Wear comfortable shoes at all times!!!) As for the hotel itself, we arrived on April 15 (Easter Saturday) to find that instead of being put in a quad room, we were being housed in two adjacent double bedrooms in an "apartment" attached to the hotel. This was not a problem (except for the tricky old-fashioned keys and a few short flights of dimly lit stairs) and the added bathroom was a plus and the rooms were typical of European hotels (small)! Rooms were sound-proof. The satellite TVs did not work in the apartment rooms --- but that did not bother us as we were not lounging around in the room for hours! The front desk staff --- especially Danilo & Angelo were most friendly and enjoyed sharing their knowledge of Rome with us. Breakfast was great (per European standards).... scrambled eggs & bacon, delicious sweet breads on Easter, croissants, proscuitto, cheese, fresh fruit, muffins, toast, etc. Cappucino & hot chocolate too! The bathrooms were a decent size with large bath towels. Rooms were clean, except for an occasional dust ball here & there. The small lock-box safe worked well to store passports & extra cash. Little foil-wrapped chocolates on the desk were a nice touch! We stayed for two nights, then went off to Florence, and returned to the Duca d'Alba for another three nights. Danilo offered to store some of our luggage while we were gone (very helpful as we were traveling via train). The only glitch in our stay at the Duca d'Alba was that, upon our return from Florence, we were placed in a room in the main hotel which was actually a double (maybe a triple) with two extra beds squeezed in ------- WAY TOO SMALL! There was barely enough room for four of us to stand with our backs against the walls and not enough room for our luggage. When I complained to the front desk clerk (Massimo?), he spoke with the manager/owner who said we could move into two double rooms (on separate floors) at an additional 30EURO per night. I found that to be unacceptable as I could not believe the accommodations we initially booked (and were charged for) would suitably serve four people and told him so. He then consulted the manager/owner again and she said they would waive the additional charge. When we got settled, 2 of us stayed on the 1st floor (room 101) & 2 of us were on the 4th floor. I recommend asking for Room 402 ----- as it has a lovely balcony with table and chairs (no great views in either room). So --- aside from that situation, our stay at this hotel was quite nice. Would we go there again ------ definitely, but I would clearly confirm the room accommodations beforehand. For one or two people ------- this would be a great choice of hotels! And who wouldn't want to go back to Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to it all!”
Reviews.Author: loafin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and it was a very good stay...quite reasonably priced. We did overhear a traveller negotiate a lower rate, on-the-spot but I prefer reservations. The desk was helpful in giving directions and bus/.trolley info. Breakfast was very good. Room was small be we were seldom there except to sleep. Within walking distance of most sights. Around the corner from the Colosseum, Forum etc. Trolley to the catacombs and bus to Vatican; we got an all-day pass one day & did them. A great little grocery store across the street(cheap water and good cheese) and many good, reasonable restaurants close around.

Reviews.Title: “Beware – Had a written confirmation&they did not have a room for me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I received a confirmation from this hotel and when I got to the hotel they did not have a room for me. They said there was confusion on their part but did NOTHING about it. When I asked what the confusion was they pulled out a notebook. The hotel uses a paper notebook...yes that is correct paper in a notebook to organize their reservations. There were not even dividers just a ton of emails in a large notebook. There are other hotels in the area so I would choose one that when you make a reservation they actually keep it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Air Conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: daucoin
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed in the adjoining hotel in a large room with dark wood floors, ceiling beams and a large marble bathroom. The air conditioning was fantastic and a blessing in the over 100 degree July weather. The location was great - walking distance to all sights and the metro. The staff was friendly and gave us a tip on an amazing trattoria just around the corner where we ate two nights in a row! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are unlucky enough to be placed in a room adjoining the main hotel be aware that the hotel does not own the entire property. This means the owners of the flats above you can play loud music whenever they like and the hotel refuses to do anything about it! Coupled with a bathroom that floods whenever you shower and a TV that doesn't work and you have a memorable experience. The staff will do anything to oblige except sort out the above problems.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location and Staff...”
Reviews.Author: Chuckandtina
Reviews.Content: The Duca D'Alba Hotel is all the positive things you'll read in this review section. We took the advice of previous writers and had a wonderful time. Here is a condensed list of tips... - Top rooms (4th floor) have great balconies with a street view. Very small. Loud. Birds on roof early in the morning. )-: - Definately empty the mini-fridge of hotel goods. Go to the market on Via Cavour. Right out of hotel,left then right on Cavour. Head toward the Forum. It's on the right. 1 liter of Coke (not Fanta!) for 1.80 Euro. The price of a can at the hotel. Fresh bread,meat,cheese,wine and snacks. - Wait till Sunday to take pictures of the Colosseum,Forum or Ancient Rome. They blocked off the roads while we were there. No cars. Great shots. - The ride back to the airport was a really nice touch by the Hotel and staff. For the same price as the Fiat ride from the airport, we rode in a new Mercedes Sedan. Unexpected pleasure. - Pizza and ice cream places all around neighborhood. Very nice. Great Gelato(ice cream) on Via Serpenti. Look for the colorful ice cream cone sign. Mango is my favorite. Pizza and a drink for two around 10 Euro. - For Americans and those who don't use the metro, you can walk to almost everything except the Vatican. It is between 6 and 12 Euros one way. We would get a taxi to the location (Hard Rock) and walk back. Going is uphill and back is downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days. I had read a number of reviews which I found very helpful. The staff at the Hotel were very friendly, the breakfast gave us an excellent start to the day. The room was very well appointed and cleaned every day to a high standard.We can recomend the small restaurant next door it was full of Italians enjoying the good food and atmosphere. Walk the short distance to the end of the road and you will see the Collesuem. We took the tourist bus on the first day to get a feel for the place and after that we found it was easy to walk everywhere, example the Forum, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. We even went to the Opera, just a short walk (10 mins) away it was brilliant. Caution!! Beware men who pull over in their cars to ask for directions they are very friendly "con artists" they want to sell you something on the cheap. We will stay in this Hotel again I hope should we ever go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Finnish1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed the hotel for 6 nights and paid 94 euros per night by cash. I think that is reasonable price considering that the hotel has a great location, relatively clean rooms and abundant buffet breakfast. The hotel is located in narrow street very close to Colosseum and ancient part of the city. We actually walked to all important tourist attaractions including Vatican which is located on the side of Tiber. There is a subway station Via Cavour only 100 meters away from the hotel and using it you can reach Vatican very rapidly but you have to change a train in Termini. One time subway ticket cost 1 euro and it was valid for 75 minutes. Even if the street in narrow there is pretty busy traffic and noise of motor bikes and other vehicles can be heard in street side rooms. There are very good pizzerias in the same street offering delicious pizza and pasta. I think 5 euros for pizza, 1 euro for bruschetta and 2 euros for 1/2 litres of house red wine are good deals in Rome. If you prefer something else you can find lots of different restaurants close to the hotel e.g. many Indian and Chinese. I have no experince of other 3 star hotels in Rome but I dare to recommend the hotel since it is difficult to say anything negative. Maybe the room was little worn, the staff could have been little more friendly and breakfast buffet was imcomplete in the first morning. But in general Duca D'alba is a good choice for exploring Rome which is a magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: georgiaguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location on a quiet narrow side street just 2 blocks from the Cavour Subway stop. It is also a less than 10 minute walk to the Colesseum and Roman Forum. Several good resturants within easy walking distance. Rooms are very small, especially the bathrooms. Large size people will have great difficulty with the 2ft by 3 ft shower. Room was kept very clean. Towels replaced daily. Ladies should bring a travel towel if you like to wrap you head after showering. Breakfast includes eggs and bacon as well as the usual breads, fruit, yogurt, milk, juices, ham and cheese. Staff speak adequate English and helpful with directions and resturant suggestions. Taxi can be called and show up on a moments notice. A good choice if you don't want to spend a lot of money and don't plan to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for a visiting rome”
Reviews.Author: oregoniantraveler
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two rooms) stayed here for six nights in Oct. 2005. Perfect location for visiting Rome, easy 2 min walk to subway (Cavour). This hotel is on a quiet, narrow street and if you ask for a quiet (tranquilo) room (105 or 206) they will give you a room without a view, but a window into a courtyard so there is no street noise at all. The rooms, bathrooms, and elevator are very small, especially the shower in room 206. If you are obese don't even think about this room. Linens were pressed (even the bidet towels) and our room was very clean the whole time. Best breakfast we had anywhere in Italy with fresh melon, proscuitto, ham, salami, eggs, bacon, fruit salad, three types of cereal, bread for toast, rolls, and croissants. Staff spoke enough English for us to communicate. AC worked and was quiet. Many dining options within an easy stroll, and we really liked Crickets and Ants (don't know the name in Italian) about ten steps away from the hotel. Highly recommend their pumpkin ravioli if you are there during the autumn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: bowwowwow
Reviews.Content: Our stay ws July. We arrived form the states in the morning and when we were taken (after a two hour wait) to our room, it was actually embarrassing. Our "triple " was so small that the woman showing us the room had to stand outside. We had only three carry on bags but there was not room for them in our tiny room. Actually, to accomodate the third bed, every thing else was removed. There was no place to STAND in the room, and the only place to sit was on the bed. Still, the AC worked very well and the room was quiet and clean. We were told that all triples are doubles with an extra bed. We asked for a room change anyway which we got after three days. The room was only a few inches bigger but it worked much better and we grew to like it so much we decided to return to Duca after Naples instead of a nicer hotel we had booked. Our third room was better than the first but not as good as the second. In all, clean, convenient to the antiquities, good AC in 2 rooms and OK in the third, wonderful interesting, less touristy neighborhood. Staff uneven but Maximilian was fantastic. We'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!! Book It If You Can!!! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: really nice hotel...great location..subway..out the door to the left..corner restaurant to the right...colosseum around the corner!! rooms are smaller but have all you need...great breakfast buffet. recommend the on/off bus system to get around town..desk staff can be a it grumpy but what the heck...cant be happy all the time....especially when dealing with us tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, wonderful staff, awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Esrun
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Duca D'Alba in Rome. It was conveniently located by the forum and coloseum, and was easily reached by the Metro (it is 30 meters from the Cavour station). The staff was wonderful and friendly and the rooms were super. The included breakfast was the best we had in Europe (and we went to 4 countries). I would strongly recommend this hotel to my family and friends, and when we return to Rome next year we will be staying at the Duca D'Alba.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineToronto
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Duca D'alba was enjoyable and comfortable. The rooms were neat and clean with friendly cleaning staff. The front desk staff was also friendly and helpful with our requests regarding tours and city information. Breakfast was above average with fresh fruit and juice offerings as well as croissants, toasts and spreads. The espresso and cappucinos were marvelous! If there was one small detracting thing, it is that the elevator had a bit of a foul smell - not sure if something was spilled on the carpet but we're confident it will be looked after. This place shows a great deal of pride of ownership. A great place to which we will return when again in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Grumps at the reception desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, our experience was that the reception staff were extremely grumpy and rude. Perhaps, it is because we had the audacity to ask if we could change rooms. We were given a room by the elevator, first floor (by the stairs) on the street side. We could hear everyone coming off the elevator, up the stairway and down the street. How inconsiderate and imposing of us to ask to move to another room and we even asked nicely. After that we were a marked guest. We were allowed to move, but felt uncomfortable until we left three days later. The room was OK - a little banged up and worn - and breakfast was nice. We were very glad to get out of there and head to Tuscany and Venice where the people were wonderful. My advice - skip the Duca D'Alba - you can get that kind of treatment in New York City and not have to travel so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great nearby restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points made by previous reviewers so won't go into detail on a few points: Breakfast is well worth going down for. Pretty substantial. Staff is extremely nice and all speak English. AC not a powerhouse but definitely helps. Want to bring a couple of other things to attention of those who stay there: 1) If you walk out of the hotel and hang a right, you'll be about 10 steps from a FANTASTIC little locals restaurant called Vecchia Roma. Wonderful bruschetta for 1 Euro, great house wine for 4 Euros a LITER, and fantastic simple pasta dishes for 6 Euros. We loved the waiter, the owner and all the food. We added in a couple of bottles of water and still ate like king/queen for 25 Euros. 2) Take a right out of the hotel, take your first left and then take a right on Via Cavour. There's a little grocery just a block or so down (toward the Colesseum) that has very cheap Cokes, beer, wine, bottled water and such. Well worth the trip vs. buying for 5 times the price across the street. We put them into our mini-bar (speaking of which, the prices for the mini-bar are cheaper than at the shop across the street -- 1.80 beer, for example) 3) English-speakers and ale lovers will also want to go to the Irish Pub right across the narrow street. It's called Finnegan and it's a good one

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return !”
Reviews.Author: Tier1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the Hotel Duca d’Alba last month. From the first moment when we were greeted with “We are expecting you” to the bed being turned down each night , our stay was enjoyable and memorable. The rooms were very clean , the location was superb for venturing out each day to see historic Rome and the breakfasts were unhurried with a good selection of fresh fruit, cereals, eggs/bacon, juices, etc. Definitely a hotel to consider if you are visiting Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Warm Staff and Cozy Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Chicpolitan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duca D'Alba is a nice little hotel right near the Colosseum. We took cabs almost everywhere and the fares were never too outlandish, which made this a nice location. The staff at this hotel was great - very helpful, friendly, and hardworking (there's even a Groucho Marx lookalike! All jokes aside, we loved him). The rooms were small, but you will encoutner that all over Europe. However, they were very clean and tidy (whether you keep it that way or not is up to you). We would maybe like to try something maybe just one or two more steps up next time we're in Rome (in terms of class), but this was by no means a poor hotel. Great location, great service, good ammenities. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: jojock
Reviews.Content: On our last night in Italy, before leaving for home we found (by default as the Hotel we had booked sent us away with vague directions as to how to find another they had contacted) the Hotel Duca d'Alba (------). It is located a few blocks from the Colosseum and reasonably near a bus stop on the Via Cavour. Down a street which ostensibly looked a bit shabby, but had interesting little shops and ristorantes we found the Hotel. It is small, yes, but nicely appointed and with courteous front desk staff. If you ask for rooms 401, 402 or 403 (doubles) you get a room with a dear little terrace on which it is pleasant for a pre-dinner drink or writing up your journal in the morning, listening to all the sounds of a Rome street coming to life. You can also listen to the (sometimes tinny) sounds of the street musicians at night playing to the ristorante patrons (but you don't have to pay them!). Anyway, we were also impressed with the very nice breakfast (after having eaten some pretty ordinary ones around Italy). The tariff was 140 euros which we thought was fairly good value in peak season. We would definitely avoid again the area around the Termini stazione - very shabby, dirty and ful of beggars and gypsies, although it's only advantage is the convenience of being near the trains and buses (as my partner hated paying for taxis).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: smurfie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome where we stayed at Duca D'Alba. Angelo and the rest of the staff were wonderful. The breakfast was a great way to start each morning (they had eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt, rolls, croissants, meats, cheeses, 2 different juices, milk, water, coffees, tea, muffins, mini pound cakes, etc). Our room was comfortable for the 3 of us (2 adults and a toddler). Very clean and quiet. There is a safe in the room (well at least in ours...305). Everything was pretty much within walking distance (the vatican we took a cab ride...never more than 8 euro). We had a car pick us up from the airport and bring us back (arranged by Angelo) which was great. The chocoalte shop a few steps away had some great candy! For those with kids there's a farmacia on Via Serpenti (if you need diapers/wipes) and the Tabacchi on the corner has milk. Across form the Cavour Metro stop at the other end is a Film place that will put your digital pics on CD's for about 5 euro (I was there almost every day). We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimulonimbus
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome last week! We stayed at the Duca d'Alba. It was in the perfect location just steps away from the Colisseum, the Roman Forum and a Metro stop. The room was a bit small; the bathroom was tinier than most American half baths, but it had a tub and shower. We also had a terrance, which didn't overlook anything but was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was hot, consisting of eggs and bacon. It wasn't the best, but it was nice to start off the day with a hot meal. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: RHE
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just a couple of nights, on a business trip. The location is convenient, but the rooms are very small - in the case of the first one I was ioffered, unacceptably so. More recently I stayed at the Quirinale, which was MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location! Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: TOTravel_Gurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 wonderful nights in April 2005. Here are the specifics: Location: This hotel is in a great location, and offers great amenities. The Metro station is so close to the hotel, you can see it from the entrance. It is so close to everything- we walked to the Coliseum, Forum, Palatine. If you want to take a cab, we went everywhere for less than 10 Euros each time. Food and Drink: The breakfast consisted of sweet croissants, rolls, muffins, cheese, ham, salami, eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt, and they will make toast for you on request. The cappuccino was amazing- definitely try it! There is a great Irish Pub right across the street, and lots of well priced, excellent restaurants in the area. The drinks in the mini bar were the same price as the corner store. Room: We had a king-sized bed, and a large wardrobe where we were able to put all our clothing. There was a desk in the room, as well as a safe for our belongings. It was an electronic safe, where you create your own code. No clock radio, but they always delivered the wake up call on time. The bathroom was very modern, with marble and a shower that always gave hot water. The towels are big…much larger that those you get in North American hotels. No face cloths as in most European hotels. The only English station is CNN, which we watched since we were in Rome during the conclave and election of the new Pope. The best part was the beautiful terrace we had, that was quiet and a great place to have an afternoon drink or, to relax in the morning. Staff: Amazing! They were great in the breakfast room, fetching us toast and cappuccino. They were great about cleaning the room, no matter what time we left. The front desk staff always recommended wonderful restaurants for us. They made our trip much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Colosseum, Forum and Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel on a charming side street, ten minute walk to the Colosseum and Forum, and steps from the Cavour Metro stop. Small rooms, but all you need for a base for exploring Rome. Nice breakfasts and pleasant, helpful staff. They provided a crib for our baby and were friendly to our children. We'd recommend the trattoria just a few steps west for lunch and the Archette de Cavour (up the steps onto Cavour) for dinner. Bars on the street outside were boisterous until late Saturday night, but the liveliness and "slice of life" quality of the street during the day more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nicoll_lj
Reviews.Content: For the money the location is fantastic. It is about 300 yards from a metro station. From the hotel you can walk to the colosseum, you can practically see it when you leave the hotel. Yes the rooms are small but the hotel has great character. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here late May, 2004. We liked it a lot. It is central to the Forum and many ruins, as well as the Colluseum. The staff were all pleasant and helpful, especially when we needed some medical help, to which they directed us. The breakfast is excellent but not extravagant and a nice way to start the day. Our room on the back courtyard was quiet, comforable and well appointed. Nearby restaurants are good and good values. Many sights are walking distance. The nearby piazza is real Rome, with a modest fountain, and it is a local gathering place. We plan to stay here again when we can again visit the Eternal City. This hotel helped us feel like Romanistas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunluver63
Reviews.Content: We had 2 triple rooms in June 2004. They were rather small but nice. The bathrooms were also nice. The breakfast was very good. The rooms were quiet and the A/C worked most of the time. I think it gets shut off during certain hours. We also had cold water one morning that we got up early. We booked online through Orbitz and got very reasonable rates - 130 euro per night. Can't complain for the money with full breakfast included.

HotelInfo.Name: Duca D'Alba Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Leonina 14, 00184 Rome, Italy
